The company is in the midst of a GLBA (Gramm–Leach–Bliley Act) audit. The auditor has asked you for a report showing that I.T. controls are in place in the organization. What is the BEST report to provide the auditor?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Provide the SOC2 Type 1 report. A SOC2 report is focused on IT services; mainly, confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and there are two types. Type 1 and Type 2. A Type1 confirms controls exist. A Type 2 confirms controls exist and that work as intended. The question is asking for a point in time as that would just show that controls are in place.
Provide the SOC1 Type 1 report is incorrect. A SOC1 report is a company’s internal control over financial reporting, i.e. accounting and financial controls. A SOC1 Type1 pertains to the audit taken place on a specific single date.
Provide the SOC2 Type 2 report is incorrect. A SOC2 report is focused on IT services; mainly, confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and there are two types. Type 1 and Type 2. A Type1 confirms controls exist. A Type 2 confirms controls exist and that work as intended.
Provide the SOC1 Type 2 report is incorrect. A SOC1 report is a company’s internal control over financial reporting, i.e. accounting and financial controls. A Soc Type2 is concerned with a more extended period of time.

questionText: The manager of a publicly traded Fortune 100 company is looking to procure new software to handle payroll transactions. Currently, they are using a legacy in-house developed software suite. One of the options available is a COTS (Commercial Off The Shelf) solution available that may fit the needs of the organization. Which of the following would be the BEST reason to purchase COTS for payroll?

choices.text: In comparison to custom software, COTS is cheaper to procure
COTS is inherently more secure than custom software
The security of COTS is easily managed
COTS does not require a comprehensive approach for security

correctAnswerText: In comparison to custom software, COTS is cheaper to procure
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: In comparison to custom software, COTS is cheaper to procure. COTS is cheaper to procure versus custom or internally developed software. Although initially cheaper, the long-term costs generally swell at a much higher rate and ends up costing more long-term.
COTS is inherently more secure than custom software is incorrect. COTS is less secure than custom-made software.
The security of COTS is easily managed is incorrect. Because COTS is generally proprietary, it becomes difficult to manage, further because the software is produced for multiple customers the security requirements will differ from the needs of your organization
COTS does not require a comprehensive approach for security is incorrect. COTS software is ubiquitous in any organization, so only a comprehensive approach will be effective. Looking at one COTS product out of context has very little meaning. COTS software management must be part of a comprehensive software security risk management. This stands in contrast to the treatment of code developed in-house. Source: https://us-cert.cisa.gov/bsi/articles/best-practices/legacy-systems/security-considerations-in-managing-cots-software

questionText: During a security audit, Sarah, a network administrator, discovers that many users have been sharing passwords to gain unauthorized access to various systems. Which of the following would BEST prevent this issue?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Deploying multi-factor authentication (MFA). Multi-factor authentication (MFA) significantly reduces the risk of unauthorized access by requiring users to provide multiple forms of verification, such as a password and a token or fingerprint. Even if passwords are shared, MFA can prevent unauthorized access.Implementing least privilege is incorrect. Least privilege ensures users have minimal access, but it doesn’t prevent password sharing.Enforcing password complexity is incorrect. While enforcing password complexity improves security, it does not stop users from sharing their passwords.Increasing password expiration frequency is incorrect. Increasing password expiration frequency may encourage better password practices but won’t directly prevent sharing.

questionText: During a Disaster Recovery (DR) simulation, Rita discovers that the selected recovery site has inadequate data restoration capabilities.  Should a disaster occur, which would be MOST likely affected?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Recovery Point Objective (RPO). RPO is the amount of data, as a measure of time, we are willing to lose during a recovery event. For example: if the RPO is one hour, an organization is willing and able to lose one hour of data without any major disruption to the business. RTO is incorrect. RTO is the earliest possible time that we can restore/recover an asset to full functionality if everything goes as planned, and nothing else goes wrong. MTD is incorrect. MTD is the amount of time we can be without the asset that is unavailable BEFORE we have to declare a disaster and call into effect our DR plan. WRT is incorrect. The WRT determines the maximum tolerable amount of time that is needed to verify the system and/or data integrity.Recovery Time Objective (RTO) is incorrect. Maximum Tolerable Downtime (MTD) is incorrect. Work Recovery Time (WRT) is incorrect.

questionText: Derek is a part of the BCP (Business continuity Plan) development team and he has just selected RAID (Redundant Array of Independent Disks) to provide redundancy for a part of his organization’s IT infrastructure. What phase of the BCP is NEXT?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Plan approval and implementation. Derek is currently in the continuity planning phase. Continuity planning is the phase of BCP development where the actual controls are selected to protect and provide redundancy to the critical path.Project scope and planning is incorrect. Project scope and planning occur before the BCP phase.BIA (Business Impact Assessment) is incorrect. The BIA phase occurs before the BCP phase.Continuity planning is incorrect. Continuity planning occurs after BCP.

questionText: Samantha is a security professional working for a medium size institution that deals with law enforcement agencies.  Samantha has been asked to perform discovery on some data and is filtering confidential data out to comply with the request.  Which should Samantha do NEXT?

choices.text: Centralize the data to assist with the discovery process

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Perform a deep inspection. Samantha is currently in the review phase. In the review phase, the applicable data is checked again to ensure veracity and to filter out any confidential data not expressly needed. The next phase would be the analysis phase where a deep inspection of content & context of remaining information to be reviewed or analyzed.Distribute information is incorrect. Centralize the data to assist with the discovery process is incorrect. Ensure protection of discoverable data is incorrect.

questionText: Joey is a firewall administrator and notices that Port 21 is open on one of the firewalls with data being transported to a foreign IP address.  What should Joey do FIRST?

choices.text: Review firewall logs to discover any information about who opened the port and when it happened.
Close the port, as FTP (File transport protocol) transports credentials and passwords in the clear.
Review the company policy about ACL’s (access control list) to help determine if the port should be open, and if the recipient is indeed legitimate.

correctAnswerText: Review firewall logs to discover any information about who opened the port and when it happened.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Review firewall logs to discover any information about who opened the port and when it happened.. The first step would be to determine what is going on before being reactive to the situation. Perhaps the exfiltration is authorized.Close the port, as FTP (File transport protocol) transports credentials and passwords in the clear. is incorrect. Closing the port without performing due diligence first would be incorrect.  Yes, FTP should not be used, and yes it has some innate risks.  But there could be legitimate reasons for it to be open.Review the company policy about ACL’s (access control list) to help determine if the port should be open, and if the recipient is indeed legitimate. is incorrect. While this is a good management-type answer, a policy would not get into specifics about which ports should be open and intended recipients.Begin IR (incident response) procedures. is incorrect. This issue is not yet an incident.  We first need to verify the veracity of the issue and then if it’s determined that this fits the mold of an incident, then we implement the IR procedures.

questionText: Derek is a part of the BCP development team and he has just selected RAID to provide redundancy for a part of his organization’s IT infrastructure. What phase of the BCP is Derek MOST likely in?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Continuity planning. Continuity planning. Continuity planning is the phase of BCP development where the actual controls are selected to protect and provide redundancy to the critical path. The project scope and planning and BIA phases occur before this and the plan approval and implementation phase occurs after.Project scope and planning is incorrect. BIA is incorrect. Plan approval and implementation is incorrect.

questionText: You are in the process of determining the administrative controls that will be needed to ensure the physical security of newly built construction.  Which of the following controls would you LEAST likely be focusing on?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Fire Detection. Site management, awareness training, and personnel controls are all considered administrative controls. Fire Detection is considered a technical control and therefore would be the least likely focused area.Personnel is incorrect. Site management is incorrect. Awareness training is incorrect.

questionText: A government agency has noticed an increase in phishing attempts targeting employees. To combat this threat, the organization is considering measures to enhance awareness and reduce susceptibility. Which action should the agency take FIRST to help mitigate this risk?

choices.text: Establish a reward system for reporting suspicious emails
Launch an internal campaign to educate staff on identifying phishing emails

correctAnswerText: Launch an internal campaign to educate staff on identifying phishing emails
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Launch an internal campaign to educate staff on identifying phishing emails. An internal campaign focused on educating employees about phishing tactics is vital to enhancing their awareness and reducing vulnerability.Implement stronger email filtering systems is incorrect. While filtering systems can help reduce the volume of phishing emails, they do not equip employees with the knowledge to recognize threats.Hire additional cybersecurity personnel is incorrect. Increasing personnel may provide additional support, but it does not directly address employee awareness.Establish a reward system for reporting suspicious emails is incorrect. A reward system may encourage reporting but does not educate employees on phishing identification.

questionText: Virginia is a developer and is working on a project related to payroll tracking.  She has just determined that MFA (multi factor authentication) is a vital security requirement.  What phase of SDLC (software development lifecycle) is NEXT?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Design. Security requirements (Virginia just determined MFA is important) are in the architecture phase of SDLC. Once these are established, the next phase is design which is focused on how we are going to deliver required functionality.Coding is incorrect. Testing is incorrect. Deployment is incorrect.

questionText: Susan is a manager at a Fortune 100 company and was alerted that the HA (High Availability) database hosted by the cloud provider was not responding after hours last night for 15 minutes. What should Susan do FIRST to ensure a proper response?

choices.text: Contact Cloud provider and discuss viable options to restore operations
Review SLA (Service level agreement) and verify that the uptime is being adhered to
Confirm the incident and assess the damage
Implement Disaster Recovery procedures and start moving operations to a hot site

correctAnswerText: Review SLA (Service level agreement) and verify that the uptime is being adhered to
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Review SLA (Service level agreement) and verify that the uptime is being adhered to. The Service level agreement will specify the availability of services. Perhaps this is a normal or scheduled outage. Even if it isn’t, just because something out of the ordinary is occurring does not mean that there is an incident.
Confirm the incident and assess the damage is incorrect. This is not an incident which makes this incorrect.
Contact Cloud provider and discuss viable options to restore operations is incorrect. Contacting the Service provider may be appropriate if this was a consistent issue and service was down for a period longer than what is specified in the contract. We just don’t have enough information here to make this the right answer.
Implement Disaster Recovery procedures and start moving operations to a hot site is incorrect. This is not a disaster so this answer is incorrect.

questionText: A software company has recently developed a proprietary applet they are planning on releasing into the market. After careful consideration they have decided to also release the source code along with the applet. Which of the following BEST describes this scenario?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Open Design. The company is providing the source code for a proprietary software they own and will be selling; this would be known as open design.Open System is incorrect. An open system is one that has published specifications in order to allow third-party organizations to develop accompanying software, components, and devices.Open Source is incorrect. Open source not only provides the source code for a software but also gives up the intellectual rights to it as well.Peer Review is incorrect. Peer review is the evaluation of work by a group of people in your field and expertise.

questionText: Judy is a CISSP® (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) and is creating a set of procedures that will be used in the event of an adverse incident. Which of the following would BEST describe this task?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: A business continuity Plan (BCP). A Business Continuity Plan (BCP) is a comprehensive document that outlines how an organization will continue to function during and after an emergency, disaster, or other disruptive event. It's designed to ensure that critical business operations can be maintained or quickly resumed, and that people, assets, and overall business processes are protected.
Key aspects of a BCP include:

Scope: It covers a wide range of potential disruptions, from natural disasters to cyber attacks.
Procedures: It provides detailed, step-by-step procedures for responding to various types of incidents.
Roles and Responsibilities: It clearly defines who is responsible for what actions during an emergency.
Communication Plans: It outlines how to communicate with employees, customers, suppliers, and other stakeholders during a crisis.
Resource Allocation: It identifies the resources needed to maintain essential functions and how to access them.
Recovery Time Objectives: It sets targets for how quickly different business functions need to be restored.
Testing and Updating: It includes provisions for regularly testing and updating the plan to ensure it remains effective.

In the context of Judy's task as a CISSP, creating a BCP aligns well with developing "a set of procedures that will be used in the event of an adverse incident." It's a more specific and actionable document compared to a broader management approach or a more narrowly focused plan like a Disaster Recovery Plan.
A BCP is an essential component of an organization's risk management strategy, helping to ensure resilience and continuity in the face of various threats and disruptions.
A business impact assessment (BIA) is incorrect. A BIA is a process that determines and evaluates the potential effects of an interruption to critical business operations as a result of a disaster, accident, or emergency. It helps identify critical business functions and their recovery requirements. While crucial, a BIA is typically a precursor to developing the full set of procedures Judy is creating.
A risk assessment is incorrect. A risk assessment is the process of identifying, analyzing, and evaluating potential risks to an organization's assets, individuals, or operations. While it's an important step in developing a business continuity plan, it's just one component of the broader task Judy is undertaking.
A Disaster recovery plan (DRP) is incorrect. A DRP is a documented process or set of procedures designed specifically to recover and protect an organization's IT infrastructure in the event of a disaster. While important, a DRP is more narrowly focused on IT systems and doesn't encompass the full range of procedures Judy is developing for various types of adverse incidents or disasters.

questionText: Jacob is a security engineer for a small organization.  The organization recently encountered an infiltration of its security perimeter.  As a result, Jacob notices a sniffer installed on an internal device.    What would be the MOST effective method the organization can implement to mitigate the attacker's ability to gain further information?

choices.text: Implement a Network Based Intrusion Detection Systems (NIDS)

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Implement logical network segmentation. Network segmentation manages traffic amongst networked devices. A segmented network is isolated from all outside communications. This isolation would require that transactions can occur only between devices within the segmented network. This segmentation would limit any pivoting by an attacker, therefore would be the best answer.Utilize a Circuit Proxy is incorrect. Implement a Network Based Intrusion Detection Systems (NIDS) is incorrect. Require strong authentication is incorrect.

questionText: Charlie is a security professional for Division Incorporated, a physical security manufacturer.  Charlie notices a breach involving Kerberos which subsequently allowed unfettered access.  What is the MOST likely cause?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Golden Ticket Attack. A Kerberos Golden Ticket is a type of attack in which an adversary gains control over an Active Directory Key Distribution Service Account (KRBTGT), and uses that account to forge valid Kerberos Ticket Granting Tickets (TGTs). This gives the attacker access to any resource on an Active Directory Domain (thus: a “Golden Ticket”).Pass-the-Hash is incorrect. Overpass-the Hash is incorrect. Pass-the-ticket is incorrect.

questionText: Harold is a security practitioner for a large conglomerate. Harold classified the data inappropriately which caused some IP (intellectual property) to be distributed to a competitor. Which of the following BEST describes Harold's role?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Harold is the Data Owner. Harold is the Data Owner. Data owners are responsible for classification of data and hold legal rights and complete control over the data they create. They are also responsible for identifying when data needs to be disposed.
Harold is the Data Steward is incorrect.  A data steward is typically responsible for ensuring data quality, governance, and data management policies. They manage data integrity and ensure compliance with data standards, but they do not hold legal ownership or the authority to classify data as a data owner does. Since Harold misclassified data, he aligns more with the role of a data owner, not a steward.
Harold is the Data Custodian is incorrect.  Data custodians are responsible for the day-to-day maintenance and protection of the data but do not have the authority to classify or make decisions regarding its use. Their role includes implementing security controls, ensuring backups, and safeguarding data. Harold’s role in this scenario involved data classification, which is beyond the scope of a data custodian's responsibilities.
Harold is the Data Processor is incorrect.  A data processor handles data on behalf of the data owner, often as a third party. They do not have authority over the classification or ownership of data; they simply process it following instructions provided by the data owner. Since Harold's actions were related to classifying the data, this option does not fit his role in this scenario.

questionText: Which of the following security controls would be BEST for addressing potential events caused by non-malicious threat actors?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Security Awareness Training (SAT). Non-malicious threat actors are authorized users who unknowingly cause an event or incident. While all the solutions listed would help to reduce potential events, security awareness training is the only one that directly addresses non-malicious actors and their potential threat.Role-based access control (RBAC) is incorrect. Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) is incorrect. Data Loss Prevention (DLP) is incorrect.

questionText: You are the  CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) of an international organization. Your organization has experienced a series of cyber-attacks that resulted in data breaches and financial losses. As the CISO you decide to implement a security program that aligns with the ISO/IEC 27001 standard.  Which of the following domains of the ISO/IEC 27001 standard are you MOST likely responsible for implementing?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Risk assessment. Risk assessment identifies potential risks to the organization’s information security and determines how to address them, making it foundational to the implementation of a security program aligned with ISO/IEC 27001.  The ISO/IEC 27001 standard defines a comprehensive framework for establishing, implementing, maintaining, and continuously improving an Information Security Management System (ISMS). The ISMS comprises several domains, including physical security, access control, risk assessment, and incident management. You are responsible for implementing the security program, which includes the implementation of controls related to access control, risk assessment, and incident management.  Physical security, on the other hand, is typically the responsibility of the facilities or operations team. 
Physical security is incorrect.  While important, this is usually overseen by facilities or physical security teams, though it can fall under the broader security program.
Access control is incorrect.  Also a key domain, but typically more focused on technical controls rather than the overall management of the security program.
Incident management is incorrect.  Incident management is critical to handling security events, but it follows from risk assessment and controls that are put in place.

questionText: A company is implementing a new access control system. Which of the following BEST describes the type of control that would be used to ensure that users can only access resources they are authorized to access?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Authorization. Authorization. Authorization involves determining what resources a user is authorized to access and ensuring that they can only access those resources. Authentication involves verifying the identity of the user, accounting involves tracking user activity, and identification involves establishing the identity of the user.Authentication is incorrect. Accounting is incorrect. Identification is incorrect.

questionText: Bryan is a Security Practitioner working for a cloud service provider when he receives an update from the datacenter regarding an incident involving one of their servers used to store the private data of some clients. Which of the following would most likely happen NEXT?

choices.text: Identify the impact of the incident.
Isolate the server to reduce potential damage.
Report the status of the incident.

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Restore affected server.. Bryan has just received an update from the datacenter providing him the status of the incident. Therefore, the next step would be to restore the system to its operational state.Report the status of the incident. is incorrect. Bryan has already received the report.  This would be the update that Bryan has received and is the step Bryan is currently in.Identify the impact of the incident. is incorrect. Identification would be done before providing an update and would be used to identify an event as an incident.Isolate the server to reduce potential damage. is incorrect. Isolation would take place during the mitigation phase of the incident response and therefore would happen before the update was provided.

questionText: A financial institution is required to conduct an annual security audit as part of regulatory compliance for Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) and Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS). The security team needs to ensure that access controls, logging, and monitoring policies align with compliance requirements.  What should be performed FIRST?

choices.text: Conduct automated vulnerability scans on authentication and access control systems
Interview system administrators to validate adherence to security policies
Review identity and access management (IAM) policies and compare them to compliance requirements
Perform penetration testing to assess the resilience of authentication mechanisms

correctAnswerText: Review identity and access management (IAM) policies and compare them to compliance requirements
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Review identity and access management (IAM) policies and compare them to compliance requirements.  Audits begin with a policy review to ensure access controls, monitoring, and security practices align with regulatory requirements such as SOX and PCI DSS.
Conduct automated vulnerability scans on authentication and access control systems is incorrect. Vulnerability scans detect technical flaws but do not assess compliance against policies.
Perform penetration testing to assess the resilience of authentication mechanisms is incorrect. Penetration testing is useful for security hardening but is not the first step in a compliance audit.
Interview system administrators to validate adherence to security policies is incorrect. Interviews may provide useful insights but should come after policy and access control reviews.

questionText: As part of a job requirement, you are deployed to a foreign country to help procure services related to IR (Incident Response).  While there, the CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) of the organization you are looking to hire offers you a sizable amount of money to provide information about your company despite you having signed an NDA (non-disclosure agreement).  Which of the following ISC2 (International Information System Security Certification Consortium) code of ethics is MOST likely broken should you accept the proposal?

choices.text: Protect society, the common good, necessary public trust and confidence, and the infrastructure.
Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally.
Provide diligent and competent service to principals.

correctAnswerText: Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally.. Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally. NDAs are legally binding contracts that protect confidential information. However, their enforceability depends on factors like clarity, reasonableness in scope, and adherence to legal standards.Protect society, the common good, necessary public trust and confidence, and the infrastructure. is incorrect. Provide diligent and competent service to principals. is incorrect. Advance and protect the profession. is incorrect.

questionText: Michael, an IT security administrator, is tasked with reviewing his company’s incident response plan after a recent data breach. What is the FIRST phase of an incident response plan that he should focus on to ensure the team is well-prepared?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Preparation. Preparation is the first phase of an incident response plan. It involves setting up policies, training, tools, and procedures that will allow the incident response team to effectively handle potential incidents. Being prepared ensures that the team can respond quickly and appropriately when an incident occurs.Containment is incorrect. Containment happens after an incident is detected, focusing on limiting damage, but it is not the first step.Detection and Analysis is incorrect. Detection and analysis occur after the preparation phase, where the team identifies and assesses potential security incidents.Eradication is incorrect. Eradication involves removing the cause of an incident and comes later in the incident response process.

questionText: Johnny is the CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) of a widget company.  He is asked to substantiate compliance with standards.  Which is the BEST way for him to achieve this?

choices.text: Perform a risk assessment based upon industry best practices.
Charter an assessor to appraise the company’s implemented safeguards in relation to its critical path.
Review Standards in relation to implemented firewall controls.
Modify and implement new policies to comply with standards.

correctAnswerText: Charter an assessor to appraise the company’s implemented safeguards in relation to its critical path.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Charter an assessor to appraise the company’s implemented safeguards in relation to its critical path.. An auditor would be best suited to verify (substantiate) compliance. Don’t get held up on verbiage too much. An assessor would assess (as would an auditor), and an appraisal is a review, and does not necessarily have to deal with money.Review Standards in relation to implemented firewall controls. is incorrect. While reviewing standards is a good choice, limiting just to firewalls is incorrect.Modify and implement new policies to comply with standards. is incorrect. You would not modify policies until an auditor reviewed compliance first and indicates they may need a review/edit.Perform a risk assessment based upon industry best practices. is incorrect. A risk assessment is used to identify threats and vulnerabilities in order to quantify/qualify risks associated with business assets.

questionText: Derek is the lead analyst and designee for his company’s business continuity planning.  Derek is distributing a BIA (Business Impact Analysis) questionnaire to his manager for sign-off.  All of the following items should be included EXCEPT?

choices.text: Identification of operational impacts of interruption

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Technological flow charts and dependencies. A business impact analysis (BIA) predicts the consequences of disruption of a business function and process and gathers information needed to develop recovery strategies. Potential loss scenarios should be identified during a risk assessment. The technological flow is not a component of a BIA; therefore, this answer is correct.Calculation of business risk interruption is incorrect. Identification of operational impacts of interruption is incorrect. Financial impact of interruption is incorrect.

questionText: Equipment failure can cause a single point of failure if not accounted for or anticipated. As a Security Practitioner there are several things to keep in mind when it comes to mitigating possible equipment failure. Which of the following would you be LEAST likely to consider when it comes to the servicing of failed equipment?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Mean Time to Failure (MTTF). MTTF is the average amount of time an asset that is not able to be repaired or serviced will operate before it fails. MTTR is the average time it will take to repair, or service failed equipment, MTBF is the predicted time between failures for repairable systems, and an SLA is a contract between a vendor and a customer that defines what services will be delivered.Service Level Agreements (SLA) is incorrect. Mean Time to Repair (MTTR) is incorrect. Mean Time Between Failure (MTBF) is incorrect.

questionText: BCS corporation has deployed server equipment throughout its various locations.  Due to organizational needs based upon its HA (high availability) data, the lifespan rating of the data store is the single most valuable component.   This is BEST known as?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Mean Time to Failure (MTTF). Mean Time to Failure. MTTF is the average amount of time an asset that is not able to be repaired or serviced will operate before it fails. MTTR is the average time it will take to repair, or service failed equipment, MTBF is the predicted average time between failures for repairable systems, and RTO is the maximum tolerable length of time that a computer, system, network or application can be down after a failure or disaster occurs.Recovery Time Objective (RTO) is incorrect. Mean Time to Repair (MTTR) is incorrect. Mean Time Between Failure (MTBF) is incorrect.

questionText: The ISO/IEC 15408 is a product evaluation model that is focused on standardizing the general approach to product evaluation and providing recognition of these evaluations globally. The structure is broken into three parts; which of the following is NOT considered a part of the structure?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Security Baseline Evaluation. The three parts of Common Criteria’s structure ISO/IEC 15408 are Introduction and General Model, Security Functional Requirements, and Security Assurance.Introduction and General Model is incorrect. Security Functional Requirements is incorrect. Security Assurance is incorrect.

questionText: Billy is tasked with implementing a solution to protect his company’s assets in the event of an emergency loss of power at his facility. After performing due diligence, he decides to install doors that remain locked in conjunction with an inlock system on the doors to allow people to exit if necessary. What BEST describes these controls?

choices.text: Billy is implementing Defense in Depth
Billy is implementing a Secure default system
Billy is implementing a Fail-Safe system
Billy is implementing a Fail Secure system

correctAnswerText: Billy is implementing a Fail-Safe system
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Billy is implementing a a Fail-Safe system. In a fail-safe system, doors remain unlocked or allow egress in the event of power failure to ensure safety, particularly for people trying to exit in emergencies.
Billy is implementing a Secure default system is incorrect.  Secure default is any setting that defaults secure and while it could refer to this feature, it is a general term therefore it isn’t the best description.
Billy is implementing a Fail-Secure system is incorrect.  Fail secure would keep the doors locked during a power failure to protect assets, but this could prevent people from exiting, which is not aligned with the safety considerations in Billy's scenario.  The presence of an "inlock system" suggests that, even in the event of a power failure, the doors will allow people to exit safely. This still points to a Fail-Safe system, as the primary concern of a fail-safe design is ensuring safety during an emergency, allowing for egress even if the doors are locked under normal conditions.
Billy is implementing Defense in Depth is incorrect. Defense in Depth is the overlapping of layers for security and doesn’t apply here.

questionText: Kimberly is tasked with ensuring compliance with her organization's operational security.  Which of the following scenarios does NOT violate SOD (separation of duties)?

choices.text: Project team performs quality assurance testing
A computer user is allowed to alter desktop configurations
Users can install software to their security profile
Security administrators can modify and purge audit logs

correctAnswerText: A computer user is allowed to alter desktop configurations
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: A computer user is allowed to alter desktop configurations. Of the available choices, altering desktop configurations is not a breach of SOD. However, the user must not be allowed to modify his/her security profile.Project team performs quality assurance testing is incorrect. Security administrators can modify and purge audit logs is incorrect. Users can install software to their security profile is incorrect.

questionText: An organization is conducting a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) to identify critical business functions and resources. During the analysis, the team needs to determine how quickly essential operations must be restored after a disruption. Which of the following is the MOST relevant metric?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Recovery Time Objective (RTO). Recovery Time Objective (RTO) is the most relevant metric, as it represents the maximum amount of time that critical business functions can be down before severely affecting the organization. It helps determine how quickly essential operations need to be restored.Recovery Point Objective (RPO) is incorrect. Recovery Point Objective (RPO) focuses on the acceptable amount of data loss, not the time to restore operations.Maximum Tolerable Downtime (MTD) is incorrect. Maximum Tolerable Downtime (MTD) defines the total time a system can be down without causing irreparable harm, but it is broader than RTO.Mean Time to Restore (MTTR) is incorrect. Mean Time to Restore (MTTR) measures the average time to repair a system, which is more focused on specific technical recovery times.

questionText: Cody is a security practitioner of a publicly traded payment card company.  Cody is researching standards to help him evaluate security products.  Which would be the BEST method?

choices.text: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards (PCI-DSS)

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Common Criteria. Common Criteria, also referred to as ISO 15408. Common Criteria is a framework in which computer system users can specify their security functional and assurance requirements in a Security Target (ST), and may be taken from Protection Profiles (PPs).Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards (PCI-DSS) is incorrect. PCI-DSS is an information security standard for organizations that handle branded credit cards from the major card schemes. This standard is not meant for the evaluation of products.ISO 27001 is incorrect. ISO/IEC 27001 is an international standard on how to manage information security. It details requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining and continually improving an information security management system (ISMS), the aim of which is to help organizations make the information assets they hold more secure.Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) is incorrect. The Sarbanes–Oxley Act of 2002 is a United States federal law that mandates certain practices in financial record keeping and reporting for corporations.

questionText: You are the CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) of a computer chip distributor and have had several notable departures from the organization resulting in a brain drain.  A third-party auditor has recently discovered that your company is not compliant with standards regarding the utilization of active asset discovery tools.  The auditor also makes note of the apparent lack of funding to properly invest in infrastructure upgrades.  What is the GREATEST risk in relation to the audit findings?

choices.text: Loss of valuable knowledge to implement solutions
Lack of manpower to mitigate risks

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Lack of company awareness. Lack of company awareness (in relation to assets in place) would be the greatest risk. Essentially, if you are not aware of what you have in the organization, how can you properly protect it either through risk mitigation, transference, or acceptance?Loss of valuable knowledge to implement solutions is incorrect. Budgetary constraints is incorrect. Lack of manpower to mitigate risks is incorrect.

questionText: Modulation is what layer of the OSI (Open Systems Interconnection) model?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Physical. Modulation is the process of modifying one or more parameters of a base communications signal such as amplitude, frequency, phase, or angle. Modulation is performed at the physical layer of the OSI Model. The process of modulation of the data also requires demodulation at the receiving end.Data link is incorrect. Transport is incorrect. Session is incorrect.

questionText: Luke is a security professional for Tooka Incorporated. Tooka is a small organization with a limited budget, but utilizes due care in relation to cybersecurity needs.  Luke notices that the company’s web, email, and FTP (file transfer protocol) websites are under constant attack from external users.  What should Luke implement to BEST withstand these attacks?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Bastion Host. A bastion host is a specialized system that is deliberately exposed on a public network. From a secured network perspective, it is the only node exposed to the outside world and is therefore very prone to attacks. A bastion host is hardened which makes it capable of withstanding such attacks. Therefore, this is the best answer.Firewall is incorrect. A firewall would detect and block attacks on an internal network.  Because the services and assets being attacked are located externally, this would be an ineffective control.  There are cases (primarily in larger organizations) where a bastion sits behind a border firewall.  The question specifically mentions that Tooka is small and budget conscious, which would allow you to infer that they do not have multiple firewalls.Screened subnet is incorrect. A screened subnet can also be called a DMZ.  A DMZ is a physical or logical subnet that separates a local area network (LAN) from other untrusted networks.  While this does help protect an organization's assets, a DMZ without a bastion host would not be sufficient.NIDS (Network Intrusion Detection System) is incorrect. A NIDS would monitor instructions from the outside to the internal network. NIDS allow the inspection of audit logs and real-time system events. Intrusion inspection is generally used to detect intrusion attempts, but they can also be employed to detect system failures or rate overall performance.  Luke has already detected the attack which makes this answer incorrect.

questionText: Peter is a network administrator for an ice cream distribution company and a CISSP®. He notices that there are packets leaving the network with addresses that seem to be coming from your network going to several unknown sources.  What is the MOST likely reason?

choices.text: The firewall has been misconfigured resulting in false negatives being generated which is resulting in a DoS (denial of service) attack
The Internal network is being used in a reconnaissance attack
The firewall has been misconfigured resulting in a false positive being generated which is resulting in a DoS (denial of service) attack
Computers in the network have been infected and are being use as a method for performing a DDoS (distributed denial of service) attack

correctAnswerText: Computers in the network have been infected and are being use as a method for performing a DDoS (distributed denial of service) attack
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Computers in the network have been infected and are being use as a method for performing a DDoS (distributed denial of service) attack. The most likely reason is that the computers on the network are being used as “zombies”, which are configured to send packets with spoofed source addresses; for example, via a Smurf or a Fraggle. A firewall misconfiguration would not generate an issue where packets are leaving the internal record. A reconnaissance attack is a method to understand the behavior of a user/s to get more information before attacking. An example would be a malicious user gathering information about the CEO before sending a spear phishing attack on them.
The firewall has been misconfigured resulting in a false positive being generated which is resulting in a DoS (denial of service) attack. is incorrect.
The firewall has been misconfigured resulting in false negatives being generated which is resulting in a DoS (denial of service) attack. is incorrect.
The Internal network is being used in a reconnaissance attack. is incorrect.

questionText: John is the manager of a small bank and is assessing the implemented controls.  Which of the following is the GREATEST concern related to misrepresentation of facts?

choices.text: Lack of uniform procedures related to accessibility
Least privilege is not uniform for publicly modifiable data
Dual control is not uniformly applied
Single sign on (SSO) authentication is improperly configured

correctAnswerText: Single sign on (SSO) authentication is improperly configured
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Single sign on (SSO) authentication is improperly configured. B. Single sign-on (SSO) authentication is improperly configured is the greatest concern when it comes to the misrepresentation of facts. Improperly configured SSO can lead to significant security risks, including unauthorized access to multiple systems and services. If SSO is compromised, it could allow attackers to gain access to sensitive data or systems without the proper credentials, leading to the potential for fraud, data breaches, and the misrepresentation of facts (data integrity). SSO is often used to streamline access across different systems, so any weaknesses in its configuration can have widespread, serious consequences.Least privilege is not uniform for publicly modifiable data is incorrect. Least privilege is not uniform for publicly modifiable data: While the principle of least privilege is important, publicly modifiable data typically involves less sensitive information. The misconfiguration here could lead to unintended modifications but is generally less concerning than a compromised authentication system.Dual control is not uniformly applied is incorrect. Dual control is the process of using two or more separate entities (usually persons) at the same time to help layer security controls for sensitive information or functions.  No single person is permitted to access or use the materials without the other.Lack of uniform procedures related to accessibility is incorrect. Procedures are the “how” of documentation.  In other words, a procedure dictates the process of how to set up or configure assets.  If the procedures are not uniformly developed to address accessibility or access, the risk of misconfiguration is high.

questionText: Rick is revamping his organization's help desk operations through the use of an ISMS (Information Security Management System).  Rick wants to ensure the main objective of confidentiality and quality management are fulfilled.   Which of the following is Rick MOST likely to use?

choices.text: COBIT (Control Objectives for Information and Related Technologies)
COSO (Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission)

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: ISO 27001. The focus of ISO 27001 is to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the information in a company. This is done through a risk assessment and then preventing such risks through risk treatment options.COBIT (Control Objectives for Information and Related Technologies) is incorrect. COBIT is a framework that connects business goals and its supporting infrastructure by providing various maturity models and metrics.ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) is incorrect. ITIL is a set of best practices for delivering IT services.  ITILs standardizes the selection, planning, delivery, and support of IT services to maximize efficiency and maintain predictable levels of service.COSO (Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission) is incorrect. COSO is an initiative that is used for evaluating internal controls including logistics, Information Technology, risk, operations and procurement.

questionText: Wooden Toys Incorporated is a toy manufacturer based in New Jersey.  The company manufactures toys using a proprietary process that increases output by 50% over competitors.  As such, the protection of IP (Intellectual property) is vital to the company’s success and the policies reflect this importance.  As the on staff CISSP® (certified information systems security professional), what do you suggest is the BEST role-based access control (RBAC) method to ensure proper adherence to the company’s business objectives?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Full RBAC. In Full RBAC, the roles are defined by the organization’s policy and access control infrastructure, and then applied to applications and systems across the enterprise.Non-RBAC is incorrect. Non-RBAC grants user access to data or an application using ACLs. There are no formal “roles” associated with mappings, other than any identified by the particular user.Limited RBAC is incorrect. Limited RBAC - users are mapped to roles within a single application rather than through an organization-wide role structure.Hybrid RBAC is incorrect. Hybrid RBAC - applies a role to multiple applications or systems based on a user’s specific role within the organization. There are also instances where the user may be assigned to roles defined solely within specific applications.

questionText: A multinational corporation is deploying Internet of Things (IoT) devices across its manufacturing plants. What is the GREATEST risk to address with these deployments?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Lack of network segmentation. Without proper network segmentation, compromised IoT devices could act as entry points for attackers to access other critical systems, posing a significant risk.Device physical tampering is incorrect. Physical tampering is a concern, but the lack of network segmentation is a bigger risk, as it could lead to broader system compromise.Absence of over-the-air updates is incorrect. Updates are important, but network segmentation helps contain the spread of an attack.Limited device processing power is incorrect. While limited processing power affects functionality, it doesn’t pose as much of a risk as inadequate network security.

questionText: Ezra is tasked with implementing physical security controls utilizing defense in depth.  Which of the following is the BEST order for proper implementation?

choices.text: Barriers outside to slow down intruders, signs prohibiting unauthorized personnel, locked doors to thwart access, and cameras inside to monitor.
6-foot fence with barbed wire to delay any intruder, signs posted beyond the fence to warn unauthorized personnel, cameras at the building to detect, and locks on the doors to deny access.

Implement warning signs and cameras at the perimeter to discourage unauthorized access, locks on doors to thwart unauthorized users, cameras inside the building to monitor, and physical barriers to slow down intruders.
Implement warning signs and cameras at the perimeter to deter, locks on doors to block access, and several locked doors to slow down intruders.

correctAnswerText: Implement warning signs and cameras at the perimeter to discourage unauthorized access, locks on doors to thwart unauthorized users, cameras inside the building to monitor, and physical barriers to slow down intruders.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Implement warning signs and cameras at the perimeter to discourage unauthorized access, locks on doors to thwart unauthorized users, cameras inside the building to monitor, and physical barriers to slow down intruders.. The correct order is deter, deny, detect, delay. All the other answers have an incorrect order.Implement warning signs and cameras at the perimeter to deter, locks on doors to block access, and several locked doors to slow down intruders. is incorrect. 6-foot fence with barbed wire to delay any intruder, signs posted beyond the fence to warn unauthorized personnel, cameras at the building to detect, and locks on the doors to deny access. is incorrect. Barriers outside to slow down intruders, signs prohibiting unauthorized personnel, locked doors to thwart access, and cameras inside to monitor. is incorrect.

questionText: Sean is responsible for the BCP/DRP (Business continuity/Disaster Recovery Plan) at his company.  What should he do FIRST?

choices.text: Establish strategies including specific business processes
Calculate the MTD (Maximum tolerable downtime) for resources

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Develop continuity policy. Development of the policy should be first and foremost. Without integration of laws, regulations, requirements, scope, and approval of the policy, how can we have a successful Plan?Establish strategies including specific business processes is incorrect. Development of the strategy would occur after we create a policy, identify critical assets (BIA), and identify the controls.Document procedures is incorrect. Documentation of procedures takes place in the development of the BCP, which also includes: recovery solutions, roles and tasks, and emergency response.Calculate the MTD (Maximum tolerable downtime) for resources is incorrect. Calculation of the MTD happens during the BIA (Business impact analysis).  We need to have a policy before we start calculating the MTD.  The BIA also entails, the identifying of critical functions and resources as well as the calculation of risks.

questionText: Parul is responsible for Disaster Recovery (DR) for her organization and is developing plans that address loss of power for her organization.  Which of the following is Parul MOST concerned with?

choices.text: Disruption from a surge creating long term loss of business functionality
Disruption from a fault causing short term power loss
Disruption from a brownout causing long term power loss
Disruption from a spike causing long term loss of availability

correctAnswerText: Disruption from a fault causing short term power loss
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Disruption from a fault causing short term power loss. Out of the options, the only one that is a type of power loss is a fault.Disruption from a brownout causing long term power loss is incorrect. A brownout is prolonged low voltage.Disruption from a surge creating long term loss of business functionality is incorrect. A surge is prolonged high voltage.Disruption from a spike causing long term loss of availability is incorrect. A spike is temporary high voltage

questionText: Jonathan is a Security Practitioner who has just signed a three-month contract to upgrade some network infrastructure for Cable Incorporated. After 30 days on the job, Jonathan is called and is asked if he can extend the contract to six months, which he willingly agrees. To his surprise when he reaches the end of his third month working, he is told his services are no longer needed. Believing he has been wronged, he takes Cable incorporated to court.  Based on the above, what is the MOST likely ruling?

choices.text: In favor of the plaintiff (Jonathan) citing the best evidence rule.
In favor of the defendant (Cable Incorporated) citing probative value rule.
In favor of the plaintiff (Jonathan) citing the Locardis Exchange Principle.
In favor of the defendant (Cable Incorporated) citing the Parol rule.

correctAnswerText: In favor of the defendant (Cable Incorporated) citing the Parol rule.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: In favor of the defendant (Cable Incorporated) citing the Parol rule.. The Parol evidence rule states when a written contract is formed it is assumed all terms have been put in the agreement, and no verbal agreements can modify the written one. The best evidence rule states that, when possible, the original and not a copy must be used as evidence. The probative value is when a piece of evidence is useful to prove something for a trial, and the Locardis exchange principle is the idea that criminals will often leave behind something when they take something.In favor of the plaintiff (Jonathan) citing the best evidence rule. is incorrect. In favor of the defendant (Cable Incorporated) citing probative value rule. is incorrect. In favor of the plaintiff (Jonathan) citing the Locardis Exchange Principle. is incorrect.

questionText: An organization is implementing a new cloud-based application. Which of the following BEST describes the type of control that would be used to ensure that data is protected in the cloud?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Encryption. Encryption. The best control for ensuring that data is protected in the cloud is encryption, which can be used to ensure that data is protected both in transit and at rest. Access controls and DLP can help prevent unauthorized access and data exfiltration, respectively, but they do not directly address the need for protecting data in the cloud. SLAs are agreements between a service provider and customer that define the level of service that will be provided, but they do not directly address security concerns.Access controls is incorrect. Data loss prevention (DLP) is incorrect. Service level agreements (SLAs) is incorrect.

questionText: Samantha is a project manager overseeing a team of developers.  After discussion with the team about the requirements, she decides to break off pieces of the project into sections and release them to customers when complete.  Which model of SDLC (system development life cycle) would BEST fit these needs?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Incremental. The incremental model is where a product is designed, implemented & tested a little bit at a time. Each component is delivered to the customer when it is complete.Iterative is incorrect. The iterative model is meant for large applications and is broken down into repeated cycles.Waterfall is incorrect. The Waterfall model utilizes a sequential approach where you cannot go back phases.  It is generally slow and deliberate.Agile is incorrect. The Agile model involves discovering requirements and developing solutions through the collaborative effort of self-organizing and cross-functional teams.   It promotes dynamic planning and encourages flexibility in relation to changes.

questionText: Rebecca works for an organization in Japan that transports various materials internationally.  Rebecca has been asked to prepare an export of computers to Western Europe.  Which of the following controls is Rebecca MOST likely to be required to follow?

choices.text: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD)

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: The Wassenaar Arrangement. The Wassenaar Arrangement was established to contribute to regional and international security and stability by promoting transparency and greater responsibility in transfers of conventional arms and dual-use goods and technologies. Computers are considered Dual-use, which makes this answer correct. ITAR is a United States regulation that controls the manufacture, sale, and distribution of defense and space-related articles and services. EAR is a U.S. regulation that sets export restrictions. Essentially, it dictates what conditions we can export. EAR applies to physical objects - sometimes referred to as "commodities" - as well as intellectual property such as technology and software. OECD is used to stimulate economic progress and world trade and is not a regulation or requirement. The OECD Declaration on Transborder Data Flows, OECD Digital Economy Paper No. 1 (Apr. 11, 1985) states: "Rapid technological developments in the field of information, computers and communications are leading to significant structural changes in the economies of Member countries. Flows of computerized data and information are an important consequence of technological advances and are playing an increasing role in national economies. With the growing economic interdependence of Member countries, these flows acquire an international dimension, known as transborder data flows."ITAR (international traffic in Arms Regulation) is incorrect. EAR (Export Administration Regulation) is incorrect. Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) is incorrect.

questionText: Jack Webb Industries manufactures an antimalware program guaranteed to keep any computer free from malware.  However unbeknownst to the company, there is a maintenance hook in the code which was developed by a programmer now working for a competitor.  Which of the following would BEST detect the presence of the maintenance hook?

choices.text: Utilize an automatic code review after release of the software
Implement auditing before release into production
Utilize a sandbox to test the software before deployment
Enforce separation of duties for all developers to ensure any code is reviewed before implementation into production

correctAnswerText: Implement auditing before release into production
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Implement auditing before release into production. Reviewing the code through auditing would best detect a maintenance hook.Enforce separation of duties for all developers to ensure any code is reviewed before implementation into production is incorrect. Utilize a sandbox to test the software before deployment is incorrect. Utilize an automatic code review after release of the software is incorrect.

questionText: You are inspecting the enclosed server room as part of your annual inspection as dictated by company policy.   Inside the server room you notice some documents labeled “Top Secret” and you also identify two fire extinguishers – one filled with carbon dioxide (CO2), the other filled with halon.  Which of the following should be the HIGHEST priority resulting from this inspection?

choices.text: The implemented fire suppression systems pose a hazard that could result in catastrophic impact and should be substituted.
The “Top Secret” documents should be stored in a more secure location.
Additional fire suppression methods should be implemented as CO2 is ineffective on combustibles.
The lack of ventilation should be remediated right away due to the impact of Halon on the ozone layer.

correctAnswerText: The implemented fire suppression systems pose a hazard that could result in catastrophic impact and should be substituted.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: The implemented fire suppression systems pose a hazard that could result in catastrophic impact and should be substituted.. Human life is most important and should be addressed immediately. CO2 and Halon pose a danger to a human if ingested.The lack of ventilation should be remediated right away due to the impact of Halon on the ozone layer. is incorrect. While the risk to the environment can affect human life, its long term and not MOST critical.  Further, there is no ventilation so there would be no effect on the Ozone.Additional fire suppression methods should be implemented as CO2 is ineffective on combustibles. is incorrect. While CO2 doesn't work on combustibles, it’s not the most important finding here.The “Top Secret” documents should be stored in a more secure location. is incorrect. While the top-secret documents are important, human life usurps it.

questionText: A business continuity plan (BCP) is being developed for a company to ensure operations can continue during a disaster. Which of the following components is MOST critical for the success of the BCP?

choices.text: Regular testing and updates of the BCP

correctAnswerText: Regular testing and updates of the BCP
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Regular testing and updates of the BCP. Regular testing and updates of the BCP are crucial for its success. A BCP must be tested to ensure its effectiveness in a disaster scenario, and regular updates are necessary to reflect any changes in the business environment, technology, or personnel.Employee training and awareness is incorrect. While employee training is important, it is most effective when supported by a regularly tested and updated plan.Documented recovery procedures is incorrect. Documented recovery procedures are essential but need to be tested and validated to ensure they work in practice.Identification of critical business functions is incorrect. Identifying critical business functions is important, but without regular testing of the plan, the recovery strategies may not be effective in a real disaster.

questionText: Ezra is an external auditor and he has found out that your company is not compliant with standards regarding the utilization of active asset discovery tools. As the on-staff CISSP® (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) in the organization, what should be the FIRST step taken after the audit?

choices.text: Research a list of products and solutions that fulfill this requirement
Perform a risk assessment to determine what the risks are of implementing such a tool
Accept the risks presented by obtaining a policy exception from your organization’s management.

fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Review the current policy. Standards are defined to set the mandatory rules that will be used to implement the policies that are in effect. Further while standards are mandatory, if they circumvent policies, then that would create an issue regarding implementation. You should review the policy to ensure that implementation of an active discovery tool is feasible FIRST, and if so, then perhaps perform other steps such as a risk assessment.
Perform a risk assessment to determine what the risks are of implementing such a tool is incorrect. A risk assessment plays a prominent role in any organization's cyber security program. However, performing a risk assessment before we verify that it would be feasible is a waste of resources.
Research a list of products and solutions that fulfill this requirement is incorrect. If an active discovery tool complies with current security policies and a risk assessment is performed. Then we can select controls. Think RMF for this. We need to prepare and categorize before we select.
Accept the risks presented by obtaining a policy exception from your organization’s management. is incorrect. While a possibility, without understanding the risks of the active asset discovery tool or lack thereof, as well as not ensuring the policies in effect meet the standards being audited, this step would not be the first thing performed.

questionText: Joey is implementing a VPN (Virtual Private Network) while utilizing NAT (network address translation). As such he is exploring several different methods. Which of the following is the LEAST likely to work properly?

choices.text: Implement PPTP (Point to Point Tunneling Protocol) to work through NAT (Network Address Translation)
Implement TLS (Transport Layer Security) to provide encryption of data in transit
Utilize SSL (Secure Socket Layer) to provide encryption of data in transit
Utilize IPSEC AH (Internet Protocol Security Authentication Header) to support the VPN (Virtual Private Network) implementation through NAT (Network Address Translation)

correctAnswerText: Utilize IPSEC AH (Internet Protocol Security Authentication Header) to support the VPN (Virtual Private Network) implementation through NAT (Network Address Translation)
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Utilize IPSEC AH (Internet Protocol Security Authentication Header) to support the VPN (Virtual Private Network) implementation through NAT (Network Address Translation). IPSEC AH is the least likely to work properly with NAT because AH includes the original IP (Internet Protocol) header in its integrity check. NAT modifies the IP address, causing the integrity check to fail, which makes IPSEC AH incompatible with NAT.
Implement TLS (Transport Layer Security) to provide encryption of data in transit is incorrect. TLS (Transport Layer Security) is compatible with NAT and effectively provides encryption for data in transit.
Utilize SSL (Secure Socket Layer) to provide encryption of data in transit is incorrect. SSL (Secure Socket Layer) also works well with NAT and provides encryption of data in transit.
Implement PPTP (Point to Point Tunneling Protocol) to work through NAT (Network Address Translation) is incorrect. PPTP (Point to Point Tunneling Protocol) was designed to work through NAT and can function correctly in such environments.

questionText: Jack is utilizing a subjective approach to a risk assessment that he is required to do for compliance purposes. As a part of this risk assessment, Jack is attempting to calculate the percentage of loss. Which of the following would BEST be used for this purpose?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Exposure Factor (EF). Exposure Factor (EF) is the percentage of loss experienced if a specific asset were attacked.
Annual rate of occurrence (ARO) is incorrect. The Annual Rate of occurrence is the frequency or likelihood at which risk will materialize over a single year. Number of Incidents / Number of Years = Annual Rate of Occurrence (likelihood) E.g. 2 incidents every 4 years 
Single Loss Expectancy (SLE) is incorrect. Single-loss expectancy is the monetary value expected from the occurrence of a risk on an asset. SLE is mathematically expressed as: Where the exposure factor is represented in the impact of the risk over the asset, or percentage of asset lost. Asset Value x Exposure Factor = Single Loss Expectancy (impact) E.g. $220M x 60% were destroyed = $132M in losses.
Annual Loss Expectancy (ALE) is incorrect. Annualized Loss Expectancy (ALE) is the yearly cost of all instances of a specified threat.

questionText: If you were looking for the ability to set limits on the possible configurations or behaviors one can set within a cloud, which of the following would you MOST likely select?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM). The CSPM provides continuous monitoring of the cloud and prevents inconsistent configuration settings across different devices.Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) is incorrect. The CASB is a security policy solution placed in between the cloud service and the client to ensure the client's security policies are enforced across on-premises and the cloud.Cloud Workload Protection Platform (CWPP) is incorrect. CWPP is a workload-focused security solution that enables the ability to perform security functions across multiple environments.Cloud Service Model (CSM) is incorrect. A CSM is a generic term for the different types of cloud service types, such as Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS).

questionText: Janet is tasked with rebuilding her network closet from scratch. While doing research, Janet decides she needs to invest in a state-of-the-art fire detection system. Due to business requirements and through risk assessments, Janet decides to implement a solution that detects extreme temperature changes. Which of the following solutions would be BEST for Janet to implement?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Rate-of-rise. Rate of Rise. The 5 fire detection types are:
    i. Fixed temperature detection - This activates when a trigger when a specific temperature is reached.
    ii. Rate-of-rise detection - When temperatures change at a level that is outside the normal threshold.
    iii. Flame actuated - Based on the infrared energy produced by the flames.
    iv. Incipient smoke detection (aspirating sensors) - These detect chemicals associated with early stages of combustion BEFORE other monitors would normally be able to detect.
   v. Ionization - Used to detect smoke.
Source:  Adam Gordon – Author of ISC2 CBK v4.
Aspirating sensors is incorrect.
Ionization monitoring is incorrect.
Infrared monitoring is incorrect.

questionText: You are the director of a government agency and have been asked to initiate the creation of a new division focused on governance, risk, and compliance.  Which of the following would be MOST appropriate for this task?

choices.text: Utilize KRI’s (Key Risk Indicators) representing the result of a BIA (Business Impact Assessment.
Utilize KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) representing implemented controls and their functionality.
Utilize KRI’s (Key Risk Indicators) referencing all vulnerabilities found that affect your current systems.
Utilize KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) referencing all vulnerabilities found that affect your current systems.

correctAnswerText: Utilize KRI’s (Key Risk Indicators) representing the result of a BIA (Business Impact Assessment.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Utilize KRI’s (Key Risk Indicators) representing the result of a BIA (Business Impact Assessment.. A KRI is meant to measure potential risk that could occur, which eliminates both answers that included a KPI. A BIA would properly provide the information needed to properly determine what the risks could be to critical business assets. A vulnerability is just one piece of a risk equation which makes that answer incorrect.Utilize KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) referencing all vulnerabilities found that affect your current systems. is incorrect. Utilize KRI’s (Key Risk Indicators) referencing all vulnerabilities found that affect your current systems. is incorrect. Utilize KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) representing implemented controls and their functionality. is incorrect.

questionText: Bobby is a director in charge of the risk management team for her organization. As required by her organization's charter, Bobby is performing a risk analysis for her organization and has done the appropriate and necessary calculations. Which of the following would occur NEXT?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Dissemination of results. After identifying Risk, we would disseminate or communicate the results. A risk assessment as per NIST SP800-30R1 lists the appropriate steps that need to be completed.
Step 1 - Prepare for Assessment
                Step 2 - Conduct Assessment
                                i. Identify threat sources & events
                                ii. Identify vulnerabilities & predisposing conditions
                                iii. Determine likelihood of occurrence
                                iv. Determine magnitude of impact
                                v. Determine Risk
                Step 3 - Communicate Results
                Step 4 - Maintain Assessment
Identification of threat events is incorrect.
Determine Risk is incorrect.
Determine likelihood of occurrence is incorrect.

questionText: You have been given evidence used in the commission of a crime and have critiqued the data.  What should you do NEXT?

choices.text: Properly maintain the integrity utilizing the procedures detailing proper preservation
Adjudicate based on the findings of the inspection
Prepare an elucidation for the involved parties
Analyze the data to help draw a proper conclusion

correctAnswerText: Prepare an elucidation for the involved parties
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Prepare an elucidation for the involved parties. The question is describing the “analysis” phase of forensics. After that occurs, we need to present which is a synonym of elucidation.Adjudicate based on the findings of the inspection is incorrect. Adjudicate (decision) would be the last phase of forensics.  This occurs after the evidence has been properly handled and reviewed.Properly maintain the integrity utilizing the procedures detailing proper preservation is incorrect. Proper preservation of evidence is vital throughout the forensics process but if we were to follow steps would occur after identification of evidence.Analyze the data to help draw a proper conclusion is incorrect. Analysis is a critique/ in-depth review.  This is the phase that has just completed, which is why this answer is incorrect.

questionText: A company’s incident response team discovers a phishing email that targets multiple employees. Which of the following actions should be taken FIRST to address this incident?

choices.text: Inform all employees about the phishing attempt
Analyze the email to identify its origin

correctAnswerText: Analyze the email to identify its origin
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Analyze the email to identify its origin. Analyzing the email to identify its origin should be the first action taken to understand the scope of the phishing attempt and determine if there are any further actions needed to mitigate risks. This analysis can provide insights into whether the email is part of a larger attack or a targeted attempt.Inform all employees about the phishing attempt is incorrect. While informing employees is important, it should come after understanding the threat and its origin to provide accurate information.Block the sender's email address is incorrect. Blocking the sender's email address is a reactive measure that may not address other potential threats stemming from the same campaign.Update the incident response plan is incorrect. Updating the incident response plan is important but should be done after assessing the incident to incorporate any lessons learned.

questionText: After experiencing a recent incident, an organization is moving their crucial information assets off premises as a means to mitigate any potential impact. Based on the Incident Management process, which of the following step are they MOST likely performing?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Lessons Learned. The organization is attempting to improve the security of the organization based on the findings of an incident response; this takes place in the Lessons Learned phase where management is delivered an incident report containing suggestions on how to improve security to avoid similar events in the future.Recovery is incorrect. Reporting is incorrect. Remediation is incorrect.

questionText: Bob is an end-user with administrative permissions and is using a company owned asset to search for adult sites.  Bob enters "Adult sites" into a search engine and the results are blocked.  What is the MOST likely explanation for blocked access?

choices.text: Rule based access controls are implemented to automatically thwart not safe for work content
Acceptable use policies are in place
A layer 5 firewall is in place stopping users from accessing not safe for work content
An IPS (Intrusion prevention system) is installed and protecting outside malicious traffic from entering the network.

correctAnswerText: Rule based access controls are implemented to automatically thwart not safe for work content
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Rule based access controls are implemented to automatically thwart not safe for work content. The question was particularly tricky as it didn’t directly say firewall. Rule based access controls are applied to Next Generation Firewalls based on categories which would have the ability to block content such as an adult website. These controls apply rules to filter out unwanted content based on predefined criteria or categories, making it the most likely explanation for why access to adult sites is blocked.A layer 5 firewall is in place stopping users from accessing not safe for work content is incorrect.
