choices.text: Utilize a faraday for the mobile phone
Connect phone to a forensic disk controller
Turn off the cellphone so integrity remains intact.
Obtain hash of cell phone data as an integrity baseline

correctAnswerText: Utilize a faraday for the mobile phone
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Utilize a faraday for the mobile phone. A faraday would block all signals to and from the cellphone which would properly isolate the device. This would fall under the “preserve” phase of e-discovery.Turn off the cellphone so integrity remains intact. is incorrect. Turning off the cell phone could erase all volatile memory, which could hold evidence that is needed.Connect phone to a forensic disk controller is incorrect. Connecting to a forensic disk controller (write blocker) would occur after a faraday is used on the phone.  A write blocker prevents new data from being written to the device, but wouldn’t stop a remote wipe like a faraday would.Obtain hash of cell phone data as an integrity baseline is incorrect. A hash is used for integrity and would be used to verify that data has not changed during evidence collection.

questionText: Santhi is a network engineer and is exploring options to implement a natively encrypted method to allow a point-to-point transmission over an untrusted network. Which of the following would BEST be suited to fit these needs?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: IP Security Protocol (IPsec). IPsec is the most commonly used protocol for a VPN. There are two primary components:
Authentication Header (AH) which provides authentication, integrity, and non-repudiation. Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP), which provides confidentiality with limited authentication.
IPSEC Operates at Layer 3, and can be deployed in either;
Transport Mode - IP packet data is encrypted, header is notTunnel Mode - Entire IP packet is encrypted & new header is added to manage transmission through the tunnel
The remaining choices do not natively encrypt which makes them incorrect.
Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) is incorrect.
Point to Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP) is incorrect.
Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP) is incorrect.

questionText: Ava is implementing a methodology to enable uniformity between business objectives and technical requirements.  She also must consider any compliance issues that may occur.  Which of the following would BEST enable her to do this?

choices.text: P.A.S.T.A (Process for Attack Simulation and Threat Analysis)

correctAnswerText: P.A.S.T.A (Process for Attack Simulation and Threat Analysis)
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: P.A.S.T.A (Process for Attack Simulation and Threat Analysis). Process for Attack Simulation and Threat Analysis (PASTA). A seven-step process for aligning business objectives and technical requirements, taking into account compliance issues and business analysis. Provides a dynamic threat identification, enumeration, and scoring process. Once the threat model is completed security subject matter experts develop a detailed analysis of the identified threats. Finally, appropriate security controls can be enumerated. Provides an attacker-centric view of the application and infrastructure from which defenders can develop an asset-centric mitigation strategy.Risk Assessment is incorrect. A risk assessment is more about overall risk to an organization with qualitative (numbers) or quantitative (very high, low, etc.) values.BIA (Business Impact assessment) is incorrect. A BIA is used to determine and evaluate the potential effects of an interruption to critical business operations as a result of a disaster, accident or emergency.SDLC (Software development life cycle) is incorrect. SDLC is a conceptual methodology that describes all in a software development project from planning to disposal.

questionText: Which of the following security countermeasures would BEST provide a proactive means to mitigate the potential for a threat actor to gain unauthorized access to your network?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Secure Default. Secure defaults would prevent potential threat actors from being able to access network devices by requiring any default usernames, passwords, or other settings be changed; removing a potential vulnerability.TPM (Trusted Platform Module) is incorrect. TPM provides full encryption on a device, such as a laptop.HIDS (Host-based Intrusion Detection System) is incorrect. A HIDS is a detective control and is not proactive.NIDS (Network-based Intrusion Detection System) is incorrect. A NIDS is a detective control and is not proactive.

questionText: Dennis is tasked with rebuilding his network closet from scratch. While doing research, Dennis decides he needs to invest in a state-of-the-art fire detection system. Due to business requirements and through risk assessments, Dennis decides to implement an early detection solution that detects chemicals. Which of the following solutions would be BEST for Dennis to implement?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Aspirating sensors. Aspiration sensors. The 5 fire detection types are:
    i. Fixed temperature detection - This activates when a trigger when a specific temperature is reached.
    ii. Rate-of-rise detection - When temperatures change at a level that is outside the normal threshold.
    iii. Flame actuated - Based on the infrared energy produced by the flames.
    iv. Incipient smoke detection (aspirating sensors) - These detect chemicals associated with early stages of combustion BEFORE other monitors would normally be able to detect.
   v. Ionization - Used to detect smoke.
Source:  Adam Gordon – Author of ISC2 CBK v4.
Ionization monitoring is incorrect.
Infrared monitoring is incorrect.
Rate-of-rise is incorrect.

questionText: James needs to comply with GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation) when handling personal data in his organization. Which of the following is the MOST likely requirement James will need to follow?

choices.text: Encrypting all stored and transmitted data
Ensuring explicit consent is obtained before processing personal data
Maintaining a backup site for disaster recovery purposes
Implementing a multifactor authentication system for access control

correctAnswerText: Ensuring explicit consent is obtained before processing personal data
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Ensuring explicit consent is obtained before processing personal data. GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation) requires organizations to obtain explicit consent from individuals before processing their personal data. This means informing individuals about how their data will be used and ensuring they agree to it before any processing begins.Encrypting all stored and transmitted data is incorrect. GDPR recommends encryption but does not mandate it for all data.Maintaining a backup site for disaster recovery purposes is incorrect. While disaster recovery is important, GDPR’s focus is on data protection and privacy rather than disaster recovery planning.Implementing a multifactor authentication system for access control is incorrect. Multifactor authentication enhances security but is not a specific requirement of GDPR. GDPR focuses on consent and data protection.

questionText: An organization recently recovered from a security breach that led to the disclosure of confidential data and has hired a Security Consultant to perform a penetration test of their network. If they have just finished establishing the metrics that will be used, which of the following will the consultant most likely perform NEXT?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Reconnaissance. When performing a penetration test, you first determine the rules of engagement. Once this is done you collect information about the client, and then probe for vulnerabilities. If any are found you attempt to exploit them and then report your results to the client. The organization has just finished determining the metrics used during the penetration test and therefore have just finished establishing the rules of engagement. This means you would next perform reconnaissance where you gather information on the client.Network Discovery Scan is incorrect. Probe Network is incorrect. Vulnerability Scan is incorrect.

questionText: Louis is a security professional for a medium sized educational institution. Louis has performed a vulnerability scan and is submitting the report for review. After some analysis, it is determined that over 40% of the hosts in scope were absent. In which phase was this error MOST likely propagated?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Discovery. Louis has not correctly performed the discovery test which resulted in incomplete data.
Enumeration is incorrect.  This phase involves gathering detailed information about identified hosts, such as services and their configurations. If hosts were missing, this phase wouldn’t be the main issue.
Reporting is incorrect.  This phase is about compiling and presenting findings. If hosts were absent during scanning, this phase wouldn’t be responsible for their absence; it would simply report what was found.
Assessment is incorrect.  This phase typically refers to evaluating the security posture of the identified systems. While errors might occur here, the absence of hosts indicates a failure in identification rather than evaluation.

questionText: Which of the following is NOT a canon in the ISC2 (International Information System Security Certification Consortium) code of ethics?

choices.text: Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and ethically.
Protect society, the common good, necessary public trust and confidence, and the infrastructure.
Provide diligent and competent service to principals.

correctAnswerText: Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and ethically.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and ethically.. The second canon states: Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally. The word ethics is not located in the four canons of the ISC2 (International Information System Security Certification Consortium) code of ethics.Protect society, the common good, necessary public trust and confidence, and the infrastructure. is incorrect. Provide diligent and competent service to principals. is incorrect. Advance and protect the profession. is incorrect.

questionText: During a security audit, Emma, a system administrator, identifies that remote access to critical systems is not recorded. What is the MOST effective way to mitigate this risk?

choices.text: Implement multifactor authentication for remote access
Enable logging for all remote access sessions
Review and update the remote access policy
Restrict remote access to critical systems

correctAnswerText: Enable logging for all remote access sessions
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Enable logging for all remote access sessions. Enabling logging provides visibility into remote access activities, which is critical for detecting and responding to unauthorized access.Implement multifactor authentication for remote access is incorrect. Multifactor authentication is important, but it does not address the lack of logging, which is the immediate issue.Restrict remote access to critical systems is incorrect. Restricting remote access may reduce the risk, but it doesn't solve the logging deficiency.Review and update the remote access policy is incorrect. Updating the remote access policy is beneficial, but the priority is to ensure logging is enabled as per existing policies.

questionText: You are a cybersecurity professional and have been asked to provide a solution that can isolate your organization’s assets to ensure they are not easily accessible. Which of the following is MOST likely addressed by your solution?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Confidentiality. The organization is looking to protect the data from unauthorized access, this is known as Confidentiality.
Integrity is incorrect.
non-repudiation is incorrect.
Availability is incorrect.

questionText: Courtney is the CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) of a medium size fast food chain and wants to help control access to specific areas of information.  As such, Courtney implements a method requiring simultaneous action to complete tasks related to accessing confidential information.   Which control BEST describes Courtney’s solution?

choices.text: Utilization of M of N control for confidential areas
Utilization of split knowledge for users looking to access confidential information
Implementation of dual control access to confidential information

correctAnswerText: Implementation of dual control access to confidential information
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Implementation of dual control access to confidential information. Dual control is the process of using two or more separate entities (usually persons) at the same time to help layer security controls for sensitive information or functions. No single person is permitted to access or use the materials without the other.Implementation of SOD (Separation of duties) is incorrect. SOD refers to the practice of dividing critical tasks among multiple individuals to prevent fraud, errors, or abuse of power. For example, one person may be responsible for initiating a financial transaction, while another approves it. While this helps with control over tasks, it doesn’t necessarily involve simultaneous action to access confidential information. SOD is about dividing responsibilities, but it doesn’t require people to act together at the same time, making it less fitting for the scenario.Utilization of M of N control for confidential areas is incorrect. M of N control is a cryptographic technique where a minimum number of individuals ("M") out of a total number ("N") are required to perform a function, such as decrypting sensitive information. For example, 3 out of 5 data custodians might be needed to unlock certain data. While this does involve multiple parties, it typically applies to cryptographic systems or data recovery processes, not necessarily the type of simultaneous action Courtney implemented for controlling access to confidential areas.Utilization of split knowledge for users looking to access confidential information is incorrect. Split knowledge is a security control where no individual has complete knowledge of a sensitive process or piece of information. This is often used in cryptographic systems, where parts of a cryptographic key are divided among individuals. Like M of N control, split knowledge focuses on ensuring no single person can independently compromise security, but it does not directly require simultaneous actions to access confidential information. It’s not as aligned with the scenario where two or more people need to act together at the same time.

questionText: Benjamin is an author of several books and wants to protect his Intellectual property. As such, Ben has been granted a copyright.  Which of the following would NOT be protected via a copyright?

choices.text: Reproduce work in any form, language, or medium

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Protect service marks from duplication. Service marks are related to a trademark which is a recognizable sign, design, or unique expression related to products or services of a particular source from those of others. The remaining answers are all protections that a copyright would provide.Reproduce work in any form, language, or medium is incorrect. Unpublished works is incorrect. Make and distribute additional copies is incorrect.

questionText: In which of the following Open Systems Interconnect (OSI) model layers would you be LEAST likely to find the Protocol Data Unit (PDU) referred to as Data?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Transport Layer. The protocol data unit (PDU) for the application layer, presentation layer, and session layer are referred to as Data; the PDUs in the transport layer are known as a Segment.Application Layer is incorrect. Presentation Layer is incorrect. Session Layer is incorrect.

questionText: Concurrent access of data resulting in suspended access is BEST known as?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Deadlock. This occurs when two users try to access the information at the same time and both are denied. – CBK 4th edition. Gordon, Adam. Pp 1282.
TOC/TOU (time of check/time of use) is incorrect. The time of check to time of use (TOCTOU or TOC/TOU) issue is a timing vulnerability that occurs when a program checks access permission too far in advance of a resource request. – CISSP® Official Study Guide 8th ed., Chappelle, Michael. Pp. 934
Need to Know is incorrect. The need-to-know principle imposes the requirement to grant users access only to data or resources they need to perform assigned work tasks. – CISSP Official Study Guide 8th ed., Chappelle, Michael. Pp 669
Denial of Service is incorrect. Denial of service is where an attacker floods a web site with many electronic message requests for service that it slows down or crashes the network or computer targeted.

questionText: Thomas is hired by a financial firm to ensure accuracy of the company's data related to an upcoming acquisition of a smaller firm.  What is the BEST method to ensure culmination of this stipulated requirement?

choices.text: Review and release strict policies and procedures related to the disclosure of company owned data
Enforce write blocking on all digital assets
Employ AES encryption to all intellectual property
Ensure backups are in place and functioning to protect against destruction of company owned data

correctAnswerText: Enforce write blocking on all digital assets
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Enforce write blocking on all digital assets. This question is asking about integrity. Of all the answers, the only one that fulfills this is write blocking.Review and release strict policies and procedures related to the disclosure of company owned data is incorrect. Employ AES encryption to all intellectual property is incorrect. Ensure backups are in place and functioning to protect against destruction of company owned data is incorrect.

questionText: An organization was recently a victim of a data breach after one of their employee's fell for a malicious email. To avoid future issues, they hired a Security consultant to perform a gap-analysis assessment, who determined the incident was caused by a lack of security management. Which of the following was MOST likely the issue?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Security Policies. Security Policies are critical in guiding employees on how to recognize and respond to security threats, such as malicious emails. If the data breach occurred due to a lack of security management, it is most likely that the organization had inadequate or poorly enforced security policies. These policies typically include guidelines for email security, phishing awareness, and incident response, which help prevent such breaches.Cybersecurity Framework is incorrect. While a cybersecurity framework provides a structured approach to managing cybersecurity risk, the immediate issue in this scenario is more likely related to the lack of specific security policies that directly address employee behavior and awareness.Strategic Plan is incorrect. The strategic plan would be created as part of security governance and enforced by the security management.  A strategic plan outlines long-term goals and objectives, including those related to security, but it is not directly responsible for the day-to-day management and enforcement of security practices that would prevent incidents like phishing attacks.Enterprise Architecture is incorrect. The enterprise architecture is created and determined as part of security governance, not security management.  Enterprise architecture involves the overall structure and operation of an organization's IT infrastructure. While important, it is less directly connected to the specific issue of employee awareness and behavior that led to the data breach.

questionText: Courtney is the CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) of a medium-size fast food chain and wants to help protect IP (intellectual property) related to recipes.  As such, she implements a method to disrupt unauthorized inspection with no two people having complete access, while enforcing AES-256 (Advanced Encryption Standard) encryption on all IP.  Which logical control BEST describes Courtney’s solution to prevent a single user from obtaining IP?

choices.text: Utilization of M of N for IP data
Utilization of split knowledge for IP data
Implementation of dual control for IP data
Implementation of Least Privilege in conjunction with need to know

correctAnswerText: Utilization of split knowledge for IP data
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Utilization of split knowledge for IP data. Split knowledge is a logical control where information is split amongst at least two people.Implementation of Least Privilege in conjunction with need to know is incorrect. Utilization of M of N for IP data is incorrect. Implementation of dual control for IP data is incorrect.

questionText: Scott is a security practitioner for a financial institution.  Scott notices specific sounds are generated when confidential information is transferred or transmitted.  Scott then deduces the type of encryption based on the sound.  Which of the following BEST describes this?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Side-channel. A side-channel is a passive, noninvasive attack to observe the operation of a device. Inference is an attack that involves using a combination of several pieces of nonsensitive information to gain access to information that should be classified at a higher level. Aggregation is collecting multiple pieces of nonsensitive information and combining it to learn sensitive information. Reconnaissance attacks often use access aggregation methods. A covert timing channel is a system feature that enables one system entity to signal information to another by utilizing its own use of a system resource in such a way as to affect system response time observed by the second entity.Inference is incorrect. Aggregation is incorrect. Covert timing channel is incorrect.

questionText: Charlie is a network engineer for a small government institution. Charlie notices that the IP addresses are not assigned for private IP addresses. Which of the following would BEST help Charlie assign an IP in the interim?

choices.text: Utilize a Dynamic NAT (Network Address Translation)
Utilize automatic private IP Addressing (APIPA) temporarily
Implement Packet switching to help deliver header information
Troubleshoot the Dynamic Host configuration protocol (DHCP) server

correctAnswerText: Utilize automatic private IP Addressing (APIPA) temporarily
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Utilize automatic private IP Addressing (APIPA) temporarily. The issue here is that DHCP is not properly assigning an IP. In order to obtain one, APIPA would be utilized. APIPA assigns an IP address in the 169.254. range to a system if DHCP stops working.
Troubleshoot the Dynamic Host configuration protocol (DHCP) server is incorrect. DHCP is not working properly, while troubleshooting would be a good first step, it doesn’t quite answer the question here as it does not assist in assigning a new IP. Question is asking for an interim fix.
Utilize a Dynamic NAT (Network Address Translation) is incorrect. Dynamic NAT rotates the internal clients among several public IP addresses to facilitate multiple clients communicating through the NAT server. This would not solve a DHCP issue.
Implement Packet switching to help deliver header information is incorrect.  Packet switching is a method of data transmission and is unrelated to IP address assignment.

questionText: An ISO (International Organization for Standardization) regulated corporation based in America is being sued by the citizens of a town near one of their locations for polluting the river. If the arbitration is based on the traditions of the international location and the organization was forced to clean up the river as penance; which of the following would MOST likely describe the law system being used?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Customary. Customary law is based on traditions and customs and typically uses restitution in the form of monetary fines or services.Regulatory is incorrect. Regulatory (or Administrative) law is created by administrative agencies.Civil is incorrect. Civil (or Tort) may be used to address issues between a person and a corporation; it isn't based around traditions.Religious is incorrect. Religious laws are based on religions and their scriptures (Islamic law, Christianity, Judaism, etc.).

questionText: A financial services company uses real-time network monitoring tools, performs regular penetration tests, and logs security events for future analysis. Which of the following BEST represents the overarching purpose of these actions?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Continuous Monitoring. Continuous monitoring involves ongoing observation of network activity to identify and respond to threats in real-time. It is an essential part of maintaining the organization’s security posture. Continuous monitoring enables the company to detect unusual activities swiftly and adjust security measures proactively.Incident Response is incorrect. Incident response deals with actions taken after a security incident has occurred, while continuous monitoring is a proactive approach to security.Compliance with regulatory requirements is incorrect. While compliance can be a result of these actions, the primary focus is on actively monitoring and responding to threats rather than simply adhering to regulations.Network Optimization is incorrect. Network optimization focuses on improving network performance and efficiency, which is separate from the security measures being employed in this scenario.

questionText: Samantha is a Security Practitioner for Billboard Industries. Samantha is currently performing a gap analysis of their network at the request of Senior Management. Throughout her analysis she has observed numerous deficiencies, including multiple single-fail points of failure, EOL (End of Life), and default settings on devices. In her report, which of the following solutions would be the BEST to recommend?

choices.text: Procure new equipment to provide redundancy and to update settings on all equipment to be secured by default.
Replace EOL equipment with new equipment and to ensure they are secured properly and only the settings required are enabled.
Procure new equipment to replace the existing EOL equipment and to eliminate any single points of failure
Decommission EOL equipment and update settings on all remaining devices to ensure they are secured properly and only the settings required are enabled.

correctAnswerText: Procure new equipment to provide redundancy and to update settings on all equipment to be secured by default.
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Procure new equipment to provide redundancy and to update settings on all equipment to be secured by default.. There are three deficiencies listed: Single-point of failure, EOL equipment, and default settings. While all three are concerns, EOL equipment is often still supported and therefore wouldn't necessarily be a risk or immediate concern and therefore the best answer is the one that addresses the two issues that would be considered an immediate concern.
Replace EOL equipment with new equipment and to ensure they are secured properly and only the settings required are enabled. is incorrect.
Procure new equipment to replace the existing EOL equipment and to eliminate any single points of failure is incorrect.
Decommission EOL equipment and update settings on all remaining devices to ensure they are secured properly and only the settings required are enabled. is incorrect.

questionText: Frank is a developer working on a vital healthcare database. He just had final approval from management.  What should FRANK do NEXT?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Release the software. Frank is in process of development; “working on a vital healthcare database”, which indicates it is past the requirements stage. Further, Management has provided “final approval”. So if the database is past requirements and has had final approval, what just happened? Accreditation. So the next phase is “release”.Obtain requirements is incorrect. Obtaining requirements would have happened earlier in the process.  Frank is working on the database, so he is at a minimum in the development phase.Go through certification is incorrect. Certification would happen before accreditation, and this is stated when the question mentions that “final approval” was granted by management.Design the software is incorrect. Designing the software would come before management grants “final approval”. The CBK mentions both architecture and design as steps in a proper SDLC.  Architecture is your high-level view, where design is your blueprint.

questionText: A large financial institution has a Privileged Access Management (PAM) system that monitors and logs all administrative actions on critical systems. A recent forensic investigation reveals that an administrator with legitimate access credentials exfiltrated customer records but deleted their session logs to hide activity.  Which of the following would BEST prevent this type of insider threat in the future?

choices.text: Require dual authorization for all database access involving customer data
Implement immutable logging and require cryptographic signing of logs
Increase monitoring frequency and trigger alerts for large data transfers
Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) for privileged users

correctAnswerText: Implement immutable logging and require cryptographic signing of logs
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Implement immutable logging and require cryptographic signing of logs.This ensures that logs cannot be altered or deleted, preserving forensic evidence. Cryptographic signing guarantees log integrity, making it possible to detect tampering.
Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) for privileged users is incorrect. MFA helps prevent unauthorized access but does not stop authorized insiders from abusing access.
Require dual authorization for all database access involving customer data is incorrect. This is impractical for daily operations and would slow down legitimate business processes. Additionally, if an attacker compromises two privileged accounts, they could still bypass this control.
Increase monitoring frequency and trigger alerts for large data transfers is incorrect. While useful for detection, this does not prevent log deletion or insider abuse. The attacker could exfiltrate data in small increments to evade detection.

questionText: Michael is a security engineer specializing in Identity and Access Management. He wants to implement methods to dynamically manage access based on contextual conditions such as geolocation, time, historical usage patterns, device type, and device registration. Which of the following would BEST be utilized to achieve this?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: CBAC (Context-Based Access Control). CBAC is specifically designed to evaluate access requests based on contextual factors that may vary depending on the situation. Unlike ABAC, which relies on attributes of users and resources, CBAC considers the current context in which access is requested, such as the user's location, time of access, and the security status of the device. This makes CBAC particularly suitable for scenarios where security posture is influenced by dynamic factors, enabling organizations to implement more granular and responsive access control measures.
JIT (Just-In-Time) is incorrect. Using the just-in-time (JIT) access methodology, organizations can provide elevated and granular privileged access to an application or system in order to perform a necessary task. This granular approach mitigates the risk of privileged account abuse by significantly reducing the amount of time a bad actor or malicious insider has to gain access to privileged accounts before moving laterally through a system and gaining unauthorized access to sensitive data. Temporary elevation allows the temporary elevation of privileges, enabling users to access privileged accounts or run privileged commands on a by-request, timed basis. Access is removed when time is up.
ABAC (Attribute based access control) is incorrect. ABAC evaluates access based on a wide range of attributes associated with users, resources, and the environment. While it considers some contextual factors, its primary focus is on static attributes rather than the dynamic context in which access is requested. This can make ABAC less responsive to real-time changes in conditions that affect security, making CBAC a more appropriate choice for Michael’s needs.
Hybrid-RBAC is incorrect. Hybrid-RBAC combines elements of Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) with other models, primarily relying on predefined roles to grant access. While it allows for some flexibility, it does not adequately address the need for evaluating dynamic contextual conditions, which is essential for understanding the security posture during access requests. CBAC offers a more granular approach by incorporating real-time context into access decisions.

questionText: Acme Corporation is a supply chain management company with 100% uptime and is looking for a solution to protect their business interests. Which of the following BEST suits their needs?

choices.text: Investment in a High availability (HA) private cloud solution
Backup solutions such as remote mirroring and remote journaling

correctAnswerText: Investment in a High availability (HA) private cloud solution
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Investment in a High availability (HA) private cloud solution. Of all the options, the only choice that directly addresses availability is the private cloud solution with High Availability. Remote journaling is transferring copies of the database transaction logs comprising of the transactions that occurred since the last bulk transfer. Remote mirroring is maintaining a live database server at a backup site. Both Remote mirroring and remote journaling are used for databases, and there is no indication that there are any in use in this question. RAID 10 is used for fault tolerance and enables both striping (speed) and mirroring but is generally not used to ensure 100% availability. Policies and procedures, while mandatory would not ensure HA, they would just help establish what to do to ensure the business needs are met.Backup solutions such as remote mirroring and remote journaling is incorrect. Enactment of a RAID 10 cluster is incorrect. Implementation of policies and procedures is incorrect.

questionText: A corporation plans to implement an information security management system (ISMS) based on ISO 27001. Which of the following is the PRIMARY benefit of adopting this standard?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Improved risk management. Improved risk management is the primary benefit of adopting ISO 27001. The standard provides a systematic approach to managing sensitive company information, allowing organizations to identify, assess, and treat information security risks effectively, leading to a stronger overall security posture.Regulatory compliance is incorrect. While ISO 27001 can help with compliance, its primary focus is on establishing a framework for effective risk management.Enhanced employee awareness is incorrect. Employee awareness is a beneficial outcome but not the main goal of implementing an ISMS based on ISO 27001.Cost reduction is incorrect. Although an effective ISMS may lead to cost savings over time, the primary intent of adopting the standard is to manage and mitigate risks.

questionText: A group of healthcare providers are studying the long-term effects of a new drug that was recently placed on the market. If they required a centralized repository to be used exclusively for the study to store the collected data, which of the following would BEST suit their needs?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Community cloud. A community cloud is provisioned in order to provide a specific community or group of people exclusive access to a shared pool of resources.Private cloud is incorrect. A private cloud is provisioned to provide a single organization exclusive access to a shared pool of resources.Public cloud is incorrect. A public cloud is provisioned for use by the general public.Hybrid cloud is incorrect. A hybrid cloud is a combination of two or more cloud types.

questionText: During a forensic investigation, Benjamin identifies a unique identifier of a compromised system. This identifier allows Benjamin to locate the manufacturer to assist him with specific information. Which layer of the OSI model would this MOST likely be located on?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: The Data Link layer. Data-Link Layer. The data- link layer prepares the packet that it receives from the network layer to be transmitted as frames on the network. Ensures that the information that it exchanges is error-free. If the data-link layer detects an error in a frame, it will request that its peer resend that frame. Media Access Control (MAC) Address is a 6-byte (48-bit) binary address in hexadecimal notation. First 3-bytes (24-bits) of the address are the manufacturer/vendor ID of the device, known as the Organizationally Unique Identifier (OUI). The last 3-bytes (24-bits) are a unique number assigned to each device within the manufacturer range.
The Application layer is incorrect. The application layer transmits data for an application or the operating system. Some common protocols on this layer.
DHCP/DHCPv6 - Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol/v6
DNS - Domain Name System
HTTP - Hypertext Transfer Protocol
LDAP - Lightweight Directory Access Protocol
SMTP - Simple Mail Transfer Protocol
FTP/TFTP - File Transfer Protocol/Trivial FTP telnet
LPD - Line Print Daemon
POP3 - Post Office Protocol 3
IMAP4 - Internet Message Access Protocol 4
SNMP - Simple Network Management Protocol
NNTP - Network News Transport Protocol
The Session layer is incorrect. The session layer provides a logical persistent connection between peer hosts. The session layer is responsible for creating, maintaining, and tearing down the session.
The Physical layer is incorrect. Physical topologies are defined at this layer. The device drivers that tell the protocol how to use the hardware are at this layer. Electrical specifications, protocols and interface standards are all present.

questionText: You are a Network Engineer for an Internet Service Provider and notice that an internal IP (internet protocol) address is attempting to open ports to an unknown and potentially questionable host.  What should you do FIRST?

choices.text: Block the port and document to ensure proper due care was performed.
Refer to firewall logs to ensure validity of the attack
Discuss with the system owner to determine the reason

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Document and evaluate the event. We need to confirm and document before we become reactionary. This could be a legitimate modification, and in order to verify the veracity, the first thing we need to do is evaluate it.Block the port and document to ensure proper due care was performed. is incorrect. We would not block the port until we know for sure this is a malicious or unwanted request/change.Refer to firewall logs to ensure validity of the attack is incorrect. While an OK choice, there is no indication that there is a firewall deployed here.  Even if there was, we need to evaluate the event before we start procedures to research what is happening.Discuss with the system owner to determine the reason is incorrect. The system owner may not know what is going on, or could be incorrect, so this would not be the first thing you should do.

questionText: Phil is a newly appointed CISO (Chief Information Security Officer). He finds several computers in his office closet, all in original packing. He looks up their records to discover the vendor had been charging annual maintenance on uninstalled equipment amounting to over 500 devices. What should Phil do FIRST?

choices.text: Review existing procedures for procurement of new equipment
Perform an asset inventory to quantify the number of affected systems
Review the contract and determine if there is a breach
Perform due diligence by calculating the total cost of maintenance paid thus far

correctAnswerText: Review the contract and determine if there is a breach
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Review the contract and determine if there is a breach. A contract would specify the terms of what should and should not occur, and the specifics about it all. If a contract is properly written and reviewed through proper due care, it should state whether (or not) the company Philip purchased equipment from can charge for maintenance despite remaining uninstalled and unused. All the other choices are important, but they should not occur until after review of the contract, as it could turn out to be time wasted if the charges are legitimate.  When the answer says breach, being security people here we think incident.  Breach in this context is meant to mean breach of contract.  This wording is by design and while strange is something that you may experience.
Perform an asset inventory to quantify the number of affected systems is incorrect.
Perform due diligence by calculating the total cost of maintenance paid thus far is incorrect.
Review existing procedures for procurement of new equipment is incorrect.

questionText: A global enterprise must comply with various privacy laws, including General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). Which of the following is the MOST important step to take when deploying a new application to ensure compliance?

choices.text: Conducting a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA)

correctAnswerText: Conducting a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA)
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Conducting a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA). Encrypting all customer data is incorrect. Encryption is important for protecting data, but it doesn’t address the compliance and risk assessment aspect, which is critical for meeting legal obligations.Hiring a Data Protection Officer (DPO) is incorrect. A DPO can help guide compliance efforts, but the immediate step when deploying a new application is to assess and mitigate data privacy risks through a DPIA.Implementing privacy-by-design principles is incorrect. Privacy-by-design is essential, but conducting a DPIA is a specific legal requirement under GDPR and should be prioritized.

questionText: Jon is attempting to procure a third-party vendor to create custom software. Which of the following would he MOST likely use if he was concerned with disclosure of his data?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA). NDAs are used to deter the disclosure of confidential information.Service Level Agreement (SLA) is incorrect. An SLA is used to guarantee a level of service but wouldn't be used to address confidentiality concerns.Request for Proposal (RFP) is incorrect. An RFP is used to solicit bids from competing companies.Statement of Work (SOW) is incorrect. An SOW is used to describe the work that is required and what is expected to potential vendors.

questionText: A company is undergoing a digital transformation and wants to implement DevSecOps practices to enhance security during software development. What should be the FIRST focus when adopting DevSecOps?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Embedding security requirements early. When adopting DevSecOps, the primary focus should be embedding security requirements early in the software development lifecycle (SDLC). This approach ensures that security is built into the foundation of the application from the very beginning rather than being an afterthought. By considering security during the requirements and design phases, developers can avoid costly vulnerabilities and rework, making the application inherently more secure.Automating code reviews is incorrect. Automating code reviews is a critical component of DevSecOps as it helps continuously assess the code for security vulnerabilities. However, automating code reviews comes after security requirements are defined and embedded in the design phase. If security is not integrated from the beginning, code reviews may miss fundamental architectural flaws or risks that could have been avoided with early security planning.Continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipelines is incorrect. CI/CD pipelines are crucial to the DevOps process, ensuring that code is built, tested, and deployed quickly and efficiently. However, security should be an integral part of the CI/CD pipeline, meaning it needs to be incorporated early in the process, not after the pipeline is already set up. Security checks, such as static analysis and vulnerability scanning, can be added to CI/CD, but this happens once security requirements have been established.Penetration testing of applications is incorrect. Penetration testing is a valuable tool for identifying vulnerabilities, but it typically happens later in the development lifecycle—after the application is functional or even deployed. Penetration testing is an external validation of security measures, but by the time it is performed, there might already be deep-rooted security flaws in the application. Thus, focusing on embedding security requirements early is more effective and ensures that security is considered at every stage of development, not just at the end.

questionText: James is responsible for implementing a disaster recovery plan for his company's primary data center. During a recent review, he realized that critical systems may not meet the Recovery Time Objective (RTO) in the event of a major outage. What is the MOST appropriate action for James to take next?

choices.text: Conduct a gap analysis to determine the causes for the delay
Update the business continuity plan to reflect the longer RTO
Prioritize high-availability technologies to reduce downtime
Implement a secondary hot site to meet the RTO

correctAnswerText: Conduct a gap analysis to determine the causes for the delay
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Conduct a gap analysis to determine the causes for the delay. Conducting a gap analysis is the most appropriate step, as it will help identify why the current RTO isn't being met and provide guidance on how to address the issue.Update the business continuity plan to reflect the longer RTO is incorrect. Updating the business continuity plan without addressing the actual issue is not a solution.Prioritize high-availability technologies to reduce downtime is incorrect. While high-availability technologies may reduce downtime, they are not the first step when the RTO isn’t being met.Implement a secondary hot site to meet the RTO is incorrect. Implementing a secondary hot site may not be necessary without fully understanding the cause of the RTO issue.

questionText: James is designing a network security strategy to protect against external attacks. Which of the following measures is the MOST effective?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Using a stateful firewall. Using a stateful firewall. A stateful firewall is the most effective for monitoring and controlling incoming and outgoing traffic based on state and protocol, providing strong protection against external attacks.Implementing a Virtual Private Network (VPN) is incorrect. While a VPN encrypts data in transit, it does not provide protection against external attacks targeting the network.Regularly updating antivirus software is incorrect. Antivirus software is important for detecting and removing malware but does not specifically protect against external network attacks.Enforcing strong password policies is incorrect. Strong password policies help secure accounts but do not address external threats to the network.

questionText: Scott is a manager of a midsized financial company and is performing a risk assessment on implemented access controls and identity management.  He is concerned that some of the biometrics are easily replicated and generated pins are easily guessed.  Which of the following BEST describes what these threats are targeting?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Confidentiality of substantiation devices. The threats are looking to exploit the confidentiality of authentication (substantiation) devices to enable disclosure.Confidentiality of authorization mechanisms is incorrect. Tokens and biometrics deal with authentication, not authorization.  Authorization would be best handled through access control mechanisms such as RBAC, least privilege, and security models.Type 3 mechanisms is incorrect. While biometrics are a type 3 device (something you are), tokens are a type 2 device (something you have)MFA (multi-factor authentication) is incorrect. The threat here is on confidentiality and the disclosure of sensitive authentication information.  MFA is a method to enable authentication, but it is not what the threats are being made against.

questionText: You are on the e-discovery team at work and have received a USB drive as part of evidence regarding a computer crime.  What is the MOST important step you must perform in order to ensure sequence of custody?

choices.text: Connect the USB drive to a forensic disk controller
Utilize a faraday for the USB drive due to the volatile memory being used for storage.
Ensure custodianship is properly handled once evidence is under review

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Ensure provenance is properly administered. Provenance refers to the history of the evidence, including how it was collected, handled, and transferred (Chain of Custody. Properly documenting the chain of custody ensures that the evidence's integrity is maintained and can be verified throughout the legal process. This is crucial for maintaining the credibility of the evidence in court.Utilize a faraday for the USB drive due to the volatile memory being used for storage. is incorrect. Ensure custodianship is properly handled once evidence is under review is incorrect. While custodianship and proper handling are important, they come after ensuring the initial documentation and chain of custody are properly established. The sequence of custody should be documented from the point of collection, not just during review.Connect the USB drive to a forensic disk controller is incorrect. Connecting the USB drive to a forensic disk controller is a part of the forensic analysis process, but it does not directly address the chain of custody. The sequence of custody focuses on documenting and preserving the evidence's history and integrity.

questionText: Jeffrey owns a shipping company and has just discovered some items in a warehouse have gone missing. Which of the following security controls would he MOST likely use if he was hoping to increase accountability?

choices.text: Enforce the use of smartcards on all doors
Reduce the number of entryways into building
Install cameras around the warehouse perimeter

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Require role and shift changes. Role and shift changes can give another person a chance to look over the work done before them and catch any mistakes or malicious activity. This reduces the time of discovery and increases the likelihood of identifying who is responsible.Install cameras around the warehouse perimeter is incorrect. While cameras can be used to detect a person committing thefts, it can only be useful if it can catch the person in the act, which is unlikely in this case.Reduce the number of entryways into building is incorrect. Reducing entryways would be a way to reduce possible threat vectors; alone it does not provide accountability.Enforce the use of smartcards on all doors is incorrect. Smartcards offer authorization but not accountability, as there is no way to know if someone used someone else's card or not.

questionText: Bob is a CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) of a glove manufacturing company and getting his product out on time is of utmost importance.  What is the GREATEST risk to his supply chain?

choices.text: Breach of PII through a malicious insider
Increased cost of rubber used in manufacturing
Imminent threat of a hurricane delaying shipment

correctAnswerText: Imminent threat of a hurricane delaying shipment
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Imminent threat of a hurricane delaying shipment. The question is asking about the availability of products. Therefore, the long-term and greatest risk is the supply chain.Theft of Intellectual property is incorrect. This answer deals more with confidentiality and doesn’t answer the question, which is asking about the availability of products reliant on supply chain.Breach of PII through a malicious insider is incorrect. This answer deals more with confidentiality and doesn’t answer the question, which is asking about the availability of products reliant on supply chain.Increased cost of rubber used in manufacturing is incorrect. While not a terrible choice, it’s still wrong.  This answer does not directly answer the question being asked, as increased price doesn’t directly correlate to a delay, further who said Bob makes rubber gloves?

questionText: Michael, a project manager, is overseeing a team that is developing a new application for a government agency. To mitigate security risks, what should Michael implement FIRST to ensure compliance with security requirements?

choices.text: Create a risk management plan for the project
Establish regular security audits during development
Involve security experts in the design phase
Set up a continuous integration and deployment pipeline

correctAnswerText: Involve security experts in the design phase
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Involve security experts in the design phase. Involving security experts in the design phase is critical to identifying and addressing security concerns early in the development process, ensuring compliance with security requirements. Engaging these specialists at the outset allows the team to incorporate security features and best practices into the architecture and design, preventing costly changes later in the development cycle. Their expertise can help define security controls, compliance needs, and threat modeling, ensuring that the application aligns with both regulatory standards and organizational security policies.Set up a continuous integration and deployment pipeline is incorrect. Setting up a continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipeline is important for streamlining development and facilitating rapid deployment. However, it does not directly address security compliance at the outset. While CI/CD practices can include security testing, they are more effective when security considerations have already been embedded in the design.Establish regular security audits during development is incorrect. While establishing regular security audits is beneficial for identifying vulnerabilities and ensuring that security controls are in place, these audits are most effective when they are integrated into the entire development process, beginning with the design phase. Implementing audits without prior design considerations may lead to the discovery of issues too late in the development lifecycle.Create a risk management plan for the project is incorrect. Creating a risk management plan is essential for addressing potential risks throughout the project. However, without the foundational input from security experts during the design phase, the plan may not adequately cover all necessary security controls and compliance requirements. Early collaboration with security specialists will provide insights that enhance the effectiveness of the risk management plan, ensuring it is robust and comprehensive.

questionText: Uma is a Network Administrator and is currently investigating issues with her organization's VOIP (Voice Over IP) network. Using a network protocol analyzer, she determines that packets are arriving at their destination in the wrong order. Which of the following issues are they MOST likely experiencing?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Jitter.  Jitter occurs when packets in a network arrive at their destination in an irregular or out-of-order manner, which is common in real-time communications like Voice Over IP (VoIP). Jitter can cause audio to be garbled or delayed because VoIP requires packets to arrive in a specific order for smooth communication.
Packet Loss is incorrect.   Packet loss refers to packets that never reach their destination, causing gaps in communication.
Latency is incorrect. Latency is the delay in packet transmission, which can cause slow communication but doesn’t necessarily result in packets arriving out of order.
Eavesdropping is incorrect. Eavesdropping is a type of sniffing attack that can also listen to and record audio communications.

questionText: Joey is a security practitioner and is assessing the performance of software modules to ensure proper operation of two components. Joey is MOST likely utilizing which testing approach?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Interface testing. Interface Testing assesses performance of modules against the interface specification(s) to ensure proper operations. There are three types:
1. Application Programming Interface (API)
2. User Interface (UI)
3. Physical Interface
SAST (static testing) is incorrect. SAST evaluates software without running it. It performs an analysis of source code or compiled application. SAST utilized a white box approach and can also help determine performance issues (bugs in the code that hinder successful execution of the software), SAST is an important way to find security problems before the software is put into production. SAST does not remediate issues, just locates them.
DAST (dynamic testing) is incorrect. DAST evaluates software in a runtime environment by executing the software to see what it does. Sandboxes are often used to isolate the code while testing. Synthetic Transactions are also often used to verify system performance by executing a script that will produce known, or expected results. DAST is also sometimes referred to as “black box testing” or “play testing.” DAST should be performed in a test environment that mimics the production environment but that is completely isolated from it. While DAST is an important method of software assessment (particularly in discovering potential interoperability problems with other production systems/software), it may not uncover flaws in the underlying code if the test team does not trigger those actions that reveal problems.
Fuzz testing is incorrect. Fuzz Testing is a specialized form of dynamic testing that uses randomized inputs to stress a system looking for unexpected outcomes. There are two types:
1. Mutation (dumb) - uses input values from actual operations of the system/software and mutates them.
2. Generational (intelligent) - develops data models and inputs based on an understanding of the types of data a program or system would use.

questionText: A technology company integrates third-party AI-based (Artificial Intelligence) anomaly detection into its security monitoring platform. A recent supply chain attack exploited a software dependency in a similar AI model, introducing backdoor vulnerabilities. The security team now needs to assess the risk of their own AI integration. Which of the following actions would BEST mitigate supply chain risks?

choices.text: Enforce Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA) by limiting API access to critical systems
Require a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) from the vendor.
Deploy the AI system in an isolated sandbox and monitor for unexpected behavior
Perform a source code review of the AI vendor's proprietary software.

correctAnswerText: Require a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) from the vendor.
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Require a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) from the vendor. An SBOM provides a full list of components, libraries, and dependencies, helping identify vulnerable third-party components in the AI software.
Perform a source code review of the AI vendor’s proprietary software is incorrect. Most vendors do not provide full source code access due to intellectual property concerns, making this option impractical.
Deploy the AI system in an isolated sandbox and monitor for unexpected behavior is incorrect. While sandboxes help detect unusual activity, they do not prevent vulnerabilities from entering production.
Enforce Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA) by limiting API access to critical systems is incorrect. ZTA controls reduce damage, but they do not identify hidden vulnerabilities in the AI model itself.

questionText: Which of the following security controls would MOST likely reduce the likelihood of an incident due to a non-malicious threat actor?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Marking. non-malicious threat actors that cause harm without intent, usually through some form of error or accident. Marking is used to identify assets and would help reduce these errors and therefore the likelihood.Honeypot is incorrect. Honeypots are used to lure malicious actors away from the parts of your network that contain your assets and to help you identify possible vulnerabilities.Security Guard is incorrect. Security Guards generally would address malicious threat actors.CCTV (Closed Circuit Television) is incorrect. CCTV may deter a malicious security actor from causing harm, however they wouldn't reduce the likelihood of an error or accident.

questionText: James is a security professional and is looking to implement a centralized remote authentication service without using 2FA (two factor authentication).  James is also looking to keep authentication and authorization separate.  Which of the following would be BEST suited?

choices.text: Extended Terminal Access Controller Access Control System (XTACACS)
Terminal Access Controller Access Control System (TACACS)
Terminal Access Controller Access Control System + (TACACS+)

correctAnswerText: Extended Terminal Access Controller Access Control System (XTACACS)
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Extended Terminal Access Controller Access Control System (XTACACS). With XTACACS authentication, authorization, and accounting are separate. RADIUS and TACACS integrate both authentication and authorization. TACACS+ uses 2FA, which makes this answer incorrect.Remote authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS) is incorrect. Terminal Access Controller Access Control System (TACACS) is incorrect. Terminal Access Controller Access Control System + (TACACS+) is incorrect.

questionText: Henry is a new CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) and a CISSP® for a bottle manufacturing company.  He is looking to revamp the security program to help create a more secure environment for both his employees and assets.  Which is the BEST way for Henry to achieve this?

choices.text: Reinforce current implementations with security controls
Devote resources on state-of-the-art equipment and train all employees on its use to ensure functionality
Ensure the coalescence of security and functionality
Implement strict security requirements on all assets to prevent data loss

correctAnswerText: Ensure the coalescence of security and functionality
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Ensure the coalescence of security and functionality. Another question with another term that may be unfamiliar. Even if you were to not understand what coalescence meant (it means to merge), you can come to this answer via the process of elimination. Implementing strict security controls on all assets seems a little too much and could end up being expensive and unnecessary. Adding security controls after the fact is also an infective method as controls should not be bolted or band-aided on. Lastly, is state-of-the-art equipment necessary to ensure proper security? Just because something is new does not make it necessary.Implement strict security requirements on all assets to prevent data loss is incorrect. Reinforce current implementations with security controls is incorrect. Devote resources on state-of-the-art equipment and train all employees on its use to ensure functionality is incorrect.

questionText: Adam is a security practitioner of Helipad Incorporated.  Adam is working on the BIA (business impact assessment) to ensure compliance with legislation.  Which phase of the Risk Management Framework is Adam MOST likely involved in?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Designation. A BIA occurs in the Categorize phase of the Risk Management Framework. While none of the answers provided are the “standard” RMF steps, some critical thinking should be utilized. Designation is just another word for Categorize, which makes this the correct answer.Enactment is incorrect. Enactment would be the Implement phase.  Because the BIA occurs in the Categorize phase, this answer is incorrect.Review is incorrect. Review would be the Assess phase.  Because the BIA occurs in the Categorize phase, this answer is incorrect.Planning is incorrect. Planning would be the Preparation phase. Because the BIA occurs in the Categorize phase, this answer is incorrect.

questionText: Charlie is a security professional for Division Incorporated, a physical security manufacturer.  As part of his duties, Charlie utilizes span port devices for network security monitoring.  Charlie notices a breach involving Kerberos and local service accounts which subsequently allowed access to a single service.  What is the MOST likely cause?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Silver Ticket Attack. A Silver Ticket is a forged Kerberos Ticket Granting Service (TGS) ticket (aka “service ticket”). They give attackers access to a single service on an application. Kerberos Silver Tickets require attackers only to have access to credentials harvested from the computer’s Security Account Manager (SAM) or local service account. Here is how it works: An adversary forges the TGS ticket using the service account password hash. No intermediary TGT (Ticket Granting Ticket) is needed. That means Silver Ticket attacks can be created without any communication with a Domain Controller, making them easier to generate and harder for targeted organizations to detect. It also means that network taps and span port devices typically used for network security monitoring won’t reliably observe the attack.Golden Ticket Attack is incorrect. Pass-the-Hash is incorrect. Pass-the-ticket is incorrect.

questionText: Sophia is a security professional for a contracting company located in an area known for high-risk natural disasters.  Sophia has been asked to concentrate on recuperation of indispensable systems and assets related to environmental concerns.  Which of the following would BEST accomplish this request?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: A Disaster recovery plan (DRP). A DRP is concerned with the recovery of critical systems. Due to the location of the organization and the requirements stipulated to Sophia, a DRP is the correct choice here.A business continuity plan (BCP) is incorrect. A BCP contains the procedures that need to be performed during a disaster.A business impact assessment (BIA) is incorrect. A BIA identifies the important business systems in case of a disaster.A risk assessment is incorrect. A risk assessment is used to identify the risks of an organization so that controls can be properly implemented or so risk can be accepted.

questionText: A security team is conducting an internal review of system resilience. They use controlled interactions to identify weaknesses and uncover an issue where unpredictable inputs trigger unintended system behavior. What is the BEST next step?

choices.text: Escalate the finding to compliance for regulatory assessment
Perform an in-depth software review and remediation
Conduct a controlled breach attempt to validate the issue
Deploy compensating controls to mitigate immediate risk

correctAnswerText: Perform an in-depth software review and remediation
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer:  Perform an in-depth software review and remediationThe issue described in the scenario suggests a software security flaw—unpredictable inputs are triggering unintended system behavior. This is a strong indicator of an input validation issue or memory handling vulnerability, such as:

Buffer overflows
Injection attacks (SQL, command injection)
Improper error handling

The best next step is to analyze the software code, identify the root cause, and apply remediation to prevent exploitation.
Conduct a controlled breach attempt to validate the issue is incorrect.  While testing the exploitability of a flaw is valuable, an internal review already identified the issue. The priority now is fixing the underlying weakness rather than further exploitation.
Escalate the finding to compliance for regulatory assessment is incorrect. Compliance may be relevant, but it’s not the first step. Addressing the security weakness should take precedence before determining regulatory implications.
Deploy compensating controls to mitigate immediate risk is incorrect. While mitigating risk is important, compensating controls should not replace direct remediation when fixing the root cause is feasible.

questionText: Ozzie works as a Security Practitioner and is analyzing his organization's potential risk as part of an organization-wide gap analysis. If he has just completed a vulnerability assessment, which of the following would he MOST likely do next?

choices.text: Establish the ARO (Annualized Rate of Occurrence).

correctAnswerText: Establish the ARO (Annualized Rate of Occurrence).
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Establish the ARO (Annualized Rate of Occurrence).. Ozzie is performing a risk assessment and has just finished assessing the organization for vulnerabilities; based on NIST SP 800-30 the next would determine the likelihood of occurrence.Identify the ALE (Annualized Loss Expectancy). is incorrect. Report results to management. is incorrect. Identify potential threat actors. is incorrect.

questionText: An organization is implementing a new disaster recovery plan with a short Recovery Time Objective (RTO). Which of the following BEST describes the type of control that would be used to ensure that critical systems can be restored in a timely manner?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Hot site. Hot site. A hot site is a fully functional backup site that can be used to restore critical systems in the event of a disaster. Cold and warm sites can take longer to activate and may not have all the necessary resources, and a mobile site is typically a temporary solution.Cold site is incorrect. Warm site is incorrect. Mobile site is incorrect.

questionText: Samantha is performing a verification of software developed for her organization related to a new payroll system.  Which of the following would Samantha NOT perform as part of this process?

choices.text: Dynamic testing through the execution of the program
Verification of documentation, code, and design

correctAnswerText: Dynamic testing through the execution of the program
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Dynamic testing through the execution of the program. Dynamic testing through the execution of the program is a validation mechanism. The other three choices are performed during verification.Verification of documentation, code, and design is incorrect. Determine conformity to specifications is incorrect. Error checking is incorrect.

questionText: Mandy works as an analyst at a medical facility where patient records are stored for the length of the legal retention period.  Mandy notices several parts of medical records stored in the relational database has wrong and unreadable information.  Which of the following is the BEST reason for the incorrect data being shown to Mandy?

choices.text: Confidentiality of the records are being protected from accidental or intentional viewing through the implementation of polyinstantiation.
The records are being protected via obfuscation and Mandy is making an incorrect inference what the proper data should be
Polymorphism of records is taking place to thwart any attempt to gather information thereby protecting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the record
Polyinstantiation is being used to protect the confidentiality and integrity of any aggregated data through modification of the records

correctAnswerText: Confidentiality of the records are being protected from accidental or intentional viewing through the implementation of polyinstantiation.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Confidentiality of the records are being protected from accidental or intentional viewing through the implementation of polyinstantiation.. Polyinstantiation is a where multiple instances of a shared resource are created to prevent a single user or process from contaminating the data and prevents against the use of inference.The records are being protected via obfuscation and Mandy is making an incorrect inference what the proper data should be is incorrect. Polyinstantiation is being used to protect the confidentiality and integrity of any aggregated data through modification of the records is incorrect. Polymorphism of records is taking place to thwart any attempt to gather information thereby protecting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the record is incorrect.

questionText: Jerome is a network engineer for a power company. Jerome is looking to automatically convert an internal IP address into a usable public address for transmission over a Wide Area Network for a single SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) related to an irrigation system. Which of the following would BEST be used for this purpose?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Stateful NAT (Network Address Translation). Stateful NAT is the use of a mapping database that maps the internal client request and the WAN service being requested. When the request is received by the NAT server, it changes the internal IP of the client to the Public IP of the NAT server and then sends the request out to the WAN. Once a reply is received, the NAT server looks up the source address of the reply in the database and delivers the data to the internal client that made the request.
There are two modes of operation:
                i. Static NAT - internal client is assigned a permanent mapping to a specific public IP address
                ii. Dynamic NAT - rotates the internal clients among several public IP addresses to facilitate multiple clients communicating through the NAT server
Automatic Private IP Addressing (APIPA) is incorrect. APIPA assigns an IP address in the 169.254. range to a system if DHCP stops working.
PAT is incorrect. PAT is an extension to NAT that permits multiple devices on a local area network (LAN) to be mapped to a single public IP address, with the intent of conserving IP addresses.
Circuit Switching is incorrect. Circuit Switching was originally designed to handle the analog phone system traffic management (POTS). Not really used any longer for data networks. Employs a set of permanent, physical connections (circuits) to reliably connect and transmit data. Used in transportation systems, power distribution systems and irrigation systems.

questionText: Sean is responsible for the BCP/DRP (Business continuity/Disaster Recovery Plan) at his company. He is implementing controls to mitigate risk. What should he do NEXT?

choices.text: Establish strategies including specific business processes
Calculate the MTD (Maximum tolerable downtime) for resources

correctAnswerText: Establish strategies including specific business processes
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Establish strategies including specific business processes. Sean has completed the Business Impact Analysis (BIA), which identifies critical business functions, potential impacts, and recovery objectives such as MTD, RTO, and RPO. After the BIA, the next logical step is to establish contingency strategies. These strategies focus on ensuring the continuation or recovery of critical business processes, the facility, user environment, and data in the event of a disruption.
Document procedures is incorrect. This phase is part of the development of the BCP and happens after a contingency (exigency) strategy is completed.
Test and improve the plan is incorrect. Testing and improving the plan would happen later on. It generally occurs after the contingency (exigent) strategies are created and the BCP is developed.
Calculate the MTD (Maximum tolerable downtime) for resources is incorrect. Calculation of the MTD would happen during the BIA before mitigating risks via the “identity preventative controls” portion.

questionText: Ravi is a manager of a technology company and is in the process of determining controls for some high-risk assets.  What should Ravi do FIRST in order to properly protect these assets?

choices.text: Categorize the assets based on classification
Implement the controls to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability are properly protected.
Select the controls that best meet needs of the organization
Review the policy to ensure protection of these assets meets the needs of the business.

correctAnswerText: Categorize the assets based on classification
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Categorize the assets based on classification. In order to properly select and deploy controls there is a need for a categorization of assets. How do you protect assets you don’t know you have or understand the value of?Select the controls that best meet needs of the organization is incorrect. We would need to categorize and classify before we select controls.Implement the controls to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability are properly protected. is incorrect. We cannot implement controls until our assets are classified and the controls are selected.Review the policy to ensure protection of these assets meets the needs of the business. is incorrect.

questionText: An organization is implementing a new web application that will process sensitive customer data. Which of the following BEST describes the type of control that would be used to ensure that the data is protected from unauthorized disclosure?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Database encryption. Database encryption. Encrypting sensitive data stored in a database helps ensure that it is protected from unauthorized disclosure. Network segmentation can help protect against network-based attacks, input validation can help prevent data from being corrupted, and secure coding practices can help prevent vulnerabilities in the application itself.Network segmentation is incorrect. Input validation is incorrect. Secure coding is incorrect.

questionText: A multinational corporation is implementing encryption for its customer data stored across several geographic locations. Local laws in some countries prevent the exportation of encryption keys.  What should the corporation prioritize when developing its encryption strategy?

choices.text: Distribute encryption keys based on geographical laws
Use a cloud-based key management system

correctAnswerText: Distribute encryption keys based on geographical laws
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer:  Distribute encryption keys based on geographical laws.  By distributing keys to local storage and management systems, the organization ensures compliance with regional laws and avoids key export restrictions.
