fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Jose should restore via a full backup. Full backups take up a lot of storage space and take the longest to perform the backup with. However, the recovery time is the fastest of the options provided. Differential backups do not reset the archive bit (the flag saying it has been backed up), but the speed of the backup and time to recover is fast. Incremental backups just backup any changes since the last full or incremental backup, which makes them the fastest to backup, but the recovery time is the slowest. Remote Journaling is the transferring of copies of the transaction logs that have occurred since the previous bulk transfer.Jose should restore using a differential backup solution is incorrect. Jose should restore using an incremental backup solution is incorrect. Jose should restore via remote journaling is incorrect.

questionText: Philip is the CTO (Chief Technology Officer) of an information technology consulting firm with strict NDA’s (Non-Disclosure Agreements) in place for all employees with government clearance. Philip discovers that two of the six staff programmers are working on software development for outside competing companies without informing the company CEO (Chief Executive Officer). What should Philip do FIRST?

choices.text: Evaluate the acceptable use policy to ensure enforceability
Review any related applicable exception documentation and/or work contracts
Approach the employees and discuss the discovery with them

correctAnswerText: Review any related applicable exception documentation and/or work contracts
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Review any related applicable exception documentation and/or work contracts. Phillip should perform due diligence first before making any decisions on the next steps. While unlikely, it is plausible that the employees were granted an exception to perform outside work. Philip should also ensure that the employees' work contracts forbid such work. An NDA would dissuade employees from sharing information, but it would not necessarily stop them from working for a competing company.
Approach the employees and discuss the discovery with them is incorrect. Approaching the employees ahead of time would be accusatory and pre-emptive. This should not be done first.
Evaluate the acceptable use policy to ensure enforceability is incorrect. An acceptable use policy is a document that summarizes the overall information security policy for users before they connect to a system or network. It would not have specifics or language regarding outside work or NDA’s.
Proceed with termination procedures is incorrect. This would be the final step of the process, once the investigation of egregious activity is completed and confirmed.

questionText: Franklin is the lead developer at an app development company specializing in games for children.  He wants to restrict certain details from users without limiting functionality.  Which of the following would BEST accomplish this?

choices.text: Abstraction of the production environment is in place
Database views are in place to prevent unauthorized editing
Separation of Duties are being applied across the organization
Policies are in place prevent unauthorized production database viewing from taking place

correctAnswerText: Abstraction of the production environment is in place
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Abstraction of the production environment is in place. Abstraction is a method to hide unnecessary details from users. This would best fit the requirement Franklin is looking for to hide certain details while keeping functionality in place.Policies are in place prevent unauthorized production database viewing from taking place is incorrect. Policies are mandatory and help set expectations.  They generally do not get into specifics about how things are done (this would be a procedure).  Further, policies would not fulfill the requirement of the question being asked here: which is essentially, a process or task that hides details for users of the app.Separation of Duties are being applied across the organization is incorrect. Separation of duties would act as a preventative measure to ensure that users/employees cannot complete a process without further checks from others.  It would not hide specific details from users, it would only prevent or deter the use of them.Database views are in place to prevent unauthorized editing is incorrect.

questionText: Jonathan works for Shine Incorporated and wants to create a digital package containing documents, graphics, and information discussing the organization and provided to select potential clients. Jonathan has informed his team that they must be able to control access to the data in the package so that it can't be edited, forwarded, copied, printed, or shared.  Which of the following BEST achieves this?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Digital Rights Management. Digital Rights Management (DRM) are the processes by which the author or publisher of a work exerts their rights to control what the purchaser of the work is entitled to do. DRM represents the controls by which you can prevent someone from copying or printing or editing or otherwise making available your privileged information to other people.
Such controls include:
i. Preventing editing and saving
ii. Preventing forwarding and sharing
iii. Preventing printing (or limiting the number of prints available)
iv. Preventing screen grabbing
v. Document expiry
vi. Document revocation
vii. Locking documents to devices, IP addresses, and country locations
viii. Watermarking documents with unique user information to establish an identity
Constrained Interface is incorrect. A constrained interface restricts user access by only allowing users to request certain functionality that is needed to perform tasks.
DLP (Data Loss Prevention) is incorrect. DLP is a set of policies, products, technologies, and techniques designed to prevent sensitive information from leaving a business or organization.
Copyright is incorrect. Copyright is a type of intellectual property that gives the owner exclusive rights to make copies of or distribute their creative work. Generally, within the US (united states) a, copyright expires 100 years after the death of its creator

questionText: Thomas is a security engineer for a nonprofit institution.  Thomas is looking to implement Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) for verifying a user’s identity.  Which of the following would BEST accomplish this?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Registration authority. Registration authority. The RA assists the certificate authority by verifying a user’s identity before it is issued a certificate by the certificate authority, neither the certificate authority nor the domain control is responsible for verifying a user’s identity. Finally, while verification of a user happens during enrollment, this is not correct as enrollment is part of the certificate lifecycle not the PKI itself.Certificate authority is incorrect. Domain controller is incorrect. Enrollment is incorrect.

questionText: William is implementing block ciphers with diffusion as part of his encryption program at work. Which of the following BEST describes this process?

choices.text: Replaces plaintext with established replacements using randomization
Each binary bit of the ciphertext is interrelated which obfuscates relationships of the plaintext and the cipher text.
Concealment of the ciphertext by modifying polyalphabetic ciphers to the plaintext
Modification of a single bit of the plaintext results in widespread changes across the ciphertext.

correctAnswerText: Modification of a single bit of the plaintext results in widespread changes across the ciphertext.
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Modification of a single bit of the plaintext results in widespread changes across the ciphertext.  Diffusion means that if we change a single bit of the plaintext, then half of the bits in the ciphertext should change, and vice versa (if ciphertext changes, then plaintext should as well).
Concealment of the ciphertext by modifying polyalphabetic ciphers to the plaintext is incorrect.  his option refers to historical encryption techniques, specifically polyalphabetic substitution ciphers, which use multiple alphabets to obscure plaintext. Although these techniques add complexity, they are not relevant to the modern cryptographic concept of diffusion. Diffusion ensures that small changes in the plaintext ripple through the ciphertext, whereas polyalphabetic ciphers focus on direct substitution to conceal plaintext patterns.
Each binary bit of the ciphertext is interrelated which obfuscates relationships of the plaintext and the cipher text is incorrect.  This option describes confusion, not diffusion. Confusion ensures that the relationship between the encryption key and the ciphertext is obscured, making it challenging for attackers to deduce the encryption key even if they have access to the plaintext and ciphertext. While confusion is a critical property of secure block ciphers, it does not address the spreading effect of small changes in the plaintext on the ciphertext, which is the hallmark of diffusion.
Replaces plaintext with established replacements using randomization is incorrect.  This describes substitution, a process in which parts of the plaintext are replaced with other values, either predefined or randomized. While substitution can contribute to obfuscating the plaintext, it does not capture the essence of diffusion. Diffusion focuses on spreading the influence of a single change in the plaintext across the entire ciphertext, whereas substitution operates locally, replacing specific parts of the plaintext.

questionText: Of the following, what is the PRIMARY reason that you categorize systems?

choices.text: To determine how the system will be tested and monitored
To determine how systems will be protected
To determine their criticality and sensitivity to the organization

correctAnswerText: To determine how systems will be protected
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: To determine how systems will be protected. To determine how they will be protected. The primary reason for categorizing systems is the same as for classifying data. It is to determine how the systems will be protected, based on the categorization given. Criticality and sensitivity are essentially the outcomes of the categorization of data, not the primary reason why we do it. Classify and label is there to throw you off as categorizing systems doesn’t classify data. Determining how the system will be tested and monitored is important but it falls under the umbrella of overall protection of systems.To determine their criticality and sensitivity to the organization is incorrect. To classify and label data is incorrect. To determine how the system will be tested and monitored is incorrect.

questionText: You are tasked with developing your company’s security program from the ground up.  After gathering requirements, the decision is made to implement security models that focus on the quality of data.  Which of the following models BEST meet this objective?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Biba and Clark-Wilson. Biba and Clark-Wilson. Your manager wants models that focus on quality of data and therefore is looking for a model that ensures Integrity. Biba and Clark-Wilson both focus on integrity, while Bell-LaPadula is focused on confidentiality and Brewer Nash is focused on conflicts of interest.Bell-LaPadula and Biba is incorrect. Brewer Nash  and Clark-Wilson is incorrect. Bell-LaPadula  and Brewer Nash is incorrect.

questionText: Joshua is a cybersecurity contractor who specializes in penetration testing. Joshua has gathered the requisite information needed related to the task. What should Joshua do NEXT?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Identify Services.  This is the correct next step after gathering initial reconnaissance data. During the information gathering and discovery phase, identifying services running on the target systems is crucial. This allows Joshua to understand the attack surface, determine what services are accessible, and start mapping potential vulnerabilities.  
There are five phases of penetration testing.  They are as follows:
    i. Planning - agreement on scope of test and rules of engagement with senior management
    ii. Information gathering & discovery (recon) - collect information about target environment(s)
    iii. Vulnerability scanning - probe for weaknesses
    iv. Exploitation - use vulnerabilities to take over system(s)
    v. Reporting - summarize findings along with recommendations
Source:  Adam Gordon – Author of ISC2 CBK v4.
Encapsulate solution is incorrect.  This is not the correct next step at this stage. Encapsulating  solution refers to summarizing or packaging findings into a solution, which is more appropriate toward the end of the penetration testing process, during or after the reporting phase. Joshua should first identify vulnerabilities and exploit them before moving to recommendations or solutions.
Leverage findings is incorrect.   This would occur after vulnerabilities are identified during the scanning and discovery process. "Leveraging findings" suggests Joshua would act on identified weaknesses, likely in the exploitation phase, which comes after vulnerability analysis. At this stage, Joshua is still gathering information and identifying services, so it's too early to leverage findings.
Locate deficiencies is incorrect.  Locating deficiencies is an important part of the vulnerability scanning and analysis phase, which comes after Joshua identifies the services running on the target environment. While this step is essential, it is premature at this stage, as Joshua hasn't yet identified what services are running and what vulnerabilities may exist.

questionText: A financial company is implementing an encryption strategy to protect data stored in the cloud. Which of the following would BEST protect the company from unauthorized access to sensitive data?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Public Key Infrastructure (PKI). Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) provides robust encryption using a combination of public and private keys, making it effective for protecting data from unauthorized access. It also supports digital signatures and certificates, which enhance security in cloud environments.Full-disk encryption is incorrect. Full-disk encryption protects data at rest on specific devices, but not data in the cloud.Symmetric encryption is incorrect. While symmetric encryption is effective, it requires secure key management, which can be challenging in a cloud environment.Tokenization is incorrect. Tokenization replaces sensitive data with tokens but may not offer the same level of protection as encryption for all cloud data.

questionText: At what phase of the system development life cycle (SDLC) are customer-specific requirements MOST likely determined?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Functional architecture. Functional architecture or functional requirements describe particular operation of the system when certain conditions are met. Essentially, these components that developers must implement to enable users to achieve their goals. System requirements or Non-functional requirements are how the system should perform certain tasks. Essentially, a non-functional requirement will describe how a system should behave as well as any limitations. Verification is essentially “Did we build this correctly?”. Initiation is the creation of a project including different strategies encompassing the scope, cost and objective.System requirements is incorrect. Verification is incorrect. Initiation is incorrect.

questionText: Joey is a security practitioner and is analyzing a compiled application in a sandbox to discover potential performance problems with other production systems/software.  Joey is MOST likely utilizing which testing approach?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: DAST (dynamic testing). DAST evaluates software in a runtime environment by executing the software to see what it does. Sandboxes are often used to isolate the code while testing. Synthetic Transactions are also often used to verify system performance by executing a script that will produce known, or expected results. DAST is also sometimes referred to as “black box testing” or “play testing.” DAST should be performed in a test environment that mimics the production environment but that is completely isolated from it. While DAST is an important method of software assessment (particularly in discovering potential interoperability problems with other production systems/software), it may not uncover flaws in the underlying code if the test team does not trigger those actions that reveal problems.SAST (static testing) is incorrect. SAST evaluates software without running it.  It performs an analysis of source code or compiled application.  SAST utilized a white box approach and can also help determine performance issues (bugs in the code that hinder successful execution of the software), SAST is an important way to find security problems before the software is put into production. SAST does not remediate issues, just locates them.Fuzz testing is incorrect. Fuzz Testing is a specialized form of dynamic testing that uses randomized inputs to stress a system looking for unexpected outcomes. There are two types:Interface testing is incorrect. Interface Testing assesses performance of modules against the interface specification(s) to ensure proper operations. There are three types:

questionText: An organization was recently a victim of a data breach after one of their employee's fell for a malicious email. To avoid future issues, they hired a Security consultant to perform a gap-analysis assessment, who determined the incident was caused by a lack of security governance. Which of the following was MOST likely the issue?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Cybersecurity Framework. Security governess is meant to provide direction for your organization's information security framework. It is where the strategic plan and security policies are created. A cybersecurity framework is a system of standards, guidelines, and best practices; it is used to manage and enforce the strategic plan and security policies.Policies is incorrect. Standards is incorrect. Best Practices is incorrect.

questionText: Acme Corporation is looking to procure a cloud-based software solution for Human Resources Management (HRM). As the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), it has been brought to your attention that the Request for Proposal (RFP) process has been completed and the business stakeholders are planning to award the contract to a solution that utilizes a Cloud Service Provider (CSP) which has servers physically located in offshore countries. Which of the following is the GREATEST concern?

choices.text: Increased difficulty in business continuity and disaster recovery planning
Security department is not involved or consulted in the RFP and contract review processes
Differing privacy regulations for data housed in offshore countries
Sensitive data exposure to malicious nation states

correctAnswerText: Security department is not involved or consulted in the RFP and contract review processes
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Security department is not involved or consulted in the RFP and contract review processes. All of the options are things a CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) should be concerned about, BUT they need to review the process going forward and make sure security is consulted to review proposals and contracts. As such not having the security department involved in the RFP is the correct answer. Different privacy regulations and sensitive data exposure are both things that would be reviewed during the course of performing due diligence.
Differing privacy regulations for data housed in offshore countries is incorrect.
Sensitive data exposure to malicious nation states is incorrect.
Increased difficulty in business continuity and disaster recovery planning is incorrect.

questionText: CHIPS ARE US is a computer chip manufacturer whose primary facility is located in a country where civil unrest has become more rampant. What is the FIRST step the chip manufacturer should take to ensure that the facility is prepared for a disaster should it occur?

choices.text: Test the Disaster Recovery plan by performing a parallel test
Implement a hot site in a more secure location

fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Perform a BIA (Business Impact Analysis). A business impact analysis (BIA) is used to identify what the critical components are of the business. This is needed in order to properly understand what the next steps are when developing a BCP/DRP (Business continuity/disaster recovery plan). Generally, a BIA is only used in business continuity/ISO 22301.
Perform a Risk Assessment is incorrect. A risk assessment is more about overall risk to an organization with qualitative (numbers) or quantitative (very high, low, etc.) values.
Test the Disaster Recovery plan by performing a parallel test is incorrect. While testing a DR plan is vital to the success of a Disaster recovery plan, it is not the first thing that should happen. This would take place after a BIA is performed so it can be implemented appropriately by protecting the critical assets of the business.
Implement a hot site in a more secure location is incorrect. An alternative site is a vital component of a DRP and it is recommended that the site whether it is Cold, Warm, Hot, Mobile should be in an alternative location separated from your main facility. However, there has not been a disaster yet, and again, just like with the testing of the DR plan, this would occur after the BIA is performed so an alternative site can be constructed properly.

questionText: Emily is developing a data protection strategy for a financial institution. She needs to ensure that sensitive financial transactions are protected during transmission over the network. To meet both regulatory requirements and secure data communications, which of the following technologies should she utilize?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Public Key Infrastructure (PKI). Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) provides a framework for managing digital certificates and encryption keys, which can be used to secure sensitive data during transmission. PKI is crucial for ensuring the confidentiality and integrity of financial transactions in accordance with regulatory requirements.Data Loss Prevention (DLP) is incorrect. DLP focuses on preventing data loss and leaks but does not specifically address the encryption of data in transit.File Integrity Monitoring (FIM) is incorrect. File Integrity Monitoring (FIM) ensures data integrity on storage but does not protect data during transmission.Secure Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTPS) is incorrect. HTTPS is used to secure web communications, but PKI offers a broader solution for managing encryption and digital certificates.

questionText: A security administrator is deploying a solution to prevent data loss from unauthorized uploads to cloud storage services. Which of the following technologies would BEST accomplish this?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Data Loss Prevention (DLP). Data Loss Prevention (DLP) solutions are designed to prevent sensitive data from being shared or uploaded to unauthorized destinations, including cloud storage services. DLP can detect and block potential data breaches before they occur.Intrusion Detection System (IDS) is incorrect. An Intrusion Detection System (IDS) monitors network traffic but does not actively block unauthorized data transfers.Network Access Control (NAC) is incorrect. Network Access Control (NAC) limits network access but does not specifically prevent data loss.Virtual Private Network (VPN) is incorrect. A VPN encrypts network traffic but does not control data movement to unauthorized cloud services.

questionText: Bulk industries have recently been the target of a number of attacks.  Last month there was a successfully exploited vulnerability which granted administrator access to one of their databanks which also allowed the transfer of confidential information. Which of the following terms would BEST describe this scenario?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Incident. This scenario is describing an event that is successful and has a negative outcome; this is known as an incident. While both attack and event can be used to describe this situation, they can also be used to describe other situations where an event or attack was not successful and therefore isn’t the best answer. Threat is incorrect because it refers to the possibility that an event might happen but isn’t used to describe events that did happen.Attack is incorrect. Event is incorrect. Threat is incorrect.

questionText: A healthcare organization is developing a mobile app that collects patient data. Which of the following would be the BEST method to ensure that sensitive health information is protected?

choices.text: Encrypting data at rest and in transit

correctAnswerText: Encrypting data at rest and in transit
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Encrypting data at rest and in transit.  Encrypting sensitive data both at rest (when it’s stored) and in transit (when it’s being transmitted) is the most effective way to ensure confidentiality and protection against unauthorized access. In a healthcare setting, sensitive patient information is highly regulated, and encryption provides an essential layer of security by making the data unreadable to anyone who does not have the correct decryption key. This approach safeguards patient information even if the data is intercepted during transmission or accessed from storage.
Implementing mobile device management (MDM) is incorrect. While Mobile Device Management (MDM) strengthens device security by controlling access and enforcing policies, it does not specifically secure the data itself. MDM is more effective for managing and securing devices rather than protecting the confidentiality of data, which encryption directly addresses.
Requiring strong passwords for access is incorrect. Strong passwords enhance user authentication but do not protect data after access has been granted. Encryption, on the other hand, ensures that the data remains protected even if an authorized account is compromised, adding a critical layer of security for sensitive information.
Applying regular security patches is incorrect. Patching helps fix known vulnerabilities, reducing the likelihood of attacks. However, encryption directly protects the sensitive health data, securing it against unauthorized access regardless of system vulnerabilities. Therefore, while patches are necessary, they do not serve the same primary purpose of protecting data confidentiality as encryption does.

questionText: A financial institution is adopting artificial intelligence (AI) to streamline fraud detection. As the CISO (Chief Information Security Officer), which of the following would be the MOST critical aspect to secure AI operations?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Protecting the training data.  Protecting training data is the highest priority because it ensures the AI system's integrity, reliability, and security. A compromised dataset leads to faulty fraud detection, making the AI ineffective or even harmful. While real-time monitoring, bias management, and privacy are essential considerations, they do not outweigh the foundational risk of training data manipulation.
Implementing real-time monitoring is incorrect. While real-time monitoring helps detect fraud in action, it does not prevent an attacker from poisoning the AI at its core. If the model is already compromised due to manipulated training data, real-time monitoring might miss fraudulent activities altogether.
Managing model bias is incorrect. Bias can lead to discriminatory practices and regulatory concerns, but it does not directly impact the security of AI operations. A biased model may be problematic, but a poisoned model is outright dangerous.
Ensuring user data privacy is incorrect. AI privacy concerns involve protecting personally identifiable information (PII) and transaction data, but if the AI model itself is corrupted, privacy controls won’t prevent fraud or system compromise. A secure AI model naturally supports data privacy, but privacy controls alone won’t stop attacks on AI integrity.

questionText: Which of the following would be MOST likely to reduce the impact of an incident due to a malicious threat actor?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: DRP (Disaster Recovery Plan). The disaster recovery plan is designed to ensure the organization can continue operating and to reduce any potential damage or loss as much as possible. Hot-sites, off-site backups, and DLP could all be used to reduce the impact of an incident; however, it would be the DRP that would determine which of these would be used, and in which scenarios in order to minimize any potential impact.Off-site Backup is incorrect. DLP (Data Loss Prevention) is incorrect. Hot-Site is incorrect.

questionText: William is a security professional for a publisher and wants to implement the Biba security model.  Which of the following BEST describes what Biba addresses in relation to integrity issues?

choices.text: Prevent unauthorized modifications of objects by authorized subjects
Protect internal and external object consistency
Maintaining internal and external consistency of data and programs.
Prevent modifications of objects by unauthorized subjects

correctAnswerText: Prevent modifications of objects by unauthorized subjects
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Prevent modifications of objects by unauthorized subjects. Biba is designed to address only the prevention of modification of objects by unauthorized subjects. The remaining choices are goals of another integrity model called Clark-Wilson.Prevent unauthorized modifications of objects by authorized subjects is incorrect. Protect internal and external object consistency is incorrect. Maintaining internal and external consistency of data and programs. is incorrect.

questionText: As a CISSP® (Certified Information System Security Professional) you must adhere to a code of ethics. A strict adherence to this code is needed to ensure that the clientele, and the public at large trust and believe that as a CISSP® holder you will act in a manner that is ethical and professional. Which of the following is NOT a required canon of the ISC2 (International Information System Security Certification Consortium) code of ethics?

choices.text: Protect society, the common good, necessary public trust and confidence, and the infrastructure.
Act honorably, honestly, responsibly, and legally.
Provide diligent and competent services to principals.
Advance and protect the Organization’s interests.

correctAnswerText: Advance and protect the Organization’s interests.
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Advance and protect the Organization’s interests.. While it is important to work in a manner that advances and protects your organization's goals and interests, this is not considered one of the four ethics canons. The four canons are ‘Protect society, the common good, necessary public trust and confidence, and the infrastructure., ’Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally’, ‘Provide diligent and competent service to principals’, and you should ‘Advance and protect the profession’.
Protect society, the common good, necessary public trust and confidence, and the infrastructure is incorrect.
Act honorably, honestly, responsibly, and legally is incorrect.
Provide diligent and competent services to principals is incorrect.

questionText: How many Preambles are REQUIRED in the ISC2 (International Information System Security Certification Consortium) code of ethics?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Two. There are two preambles in the ISC2 code of ethics and both are a requirement. The preambles states:
1. The safety and welfare of society and the common good, duty to our principals, and to each other, requires that we adhere, and be seen to adhere, to the highest ethical standards of behavior.
2. Therefore, strict adherence to this Code is a condition of certification.
One is incorrect.
Three is incorrect.
Zero is incorrect.

questionText: You work as a Security Practitioner for Straw Incorporated and are tasked with the facility security of a datacenter. One evening, you notice a hole in the security fence surrounding the property.  Upon research, it is apparent that the hole was cut by a bad actor who is now somewhere on the premises. In this scenario, according to the functional order of controls, which control would most likely be NEXT?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Deny. Deny. According to the functional order of controls you should deter, deny, detect, delay, determine, and then decide. The intruder has bypassed the perimeter security fence which is used as a deter control and therefore the next control should be deny.Detect is incorrect. Deter is incorrect. Delay is incorrect.

questionText: Henry is implementing security controls in an industrial complex that deals with the manufacturing of top secret and potentially toxic materials.  As part of his execution, he has decided to install emergency lighting.  What is the PRIMARY purpose of emergency lighting?

choices.text: Promote safe passage during an emergency.
Provide an operative method for delaying unauthorized entry into the facility without being seen.
Provide a method for rescue teams to safely evacuate distressed personnel during a terrorist attack.
Allow emergency personnel to enter the facility in the event of an emergency.

correctAnswerText: Promote safe passage during an emergency.
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Promote safe passage during an emergency.. Human safety will always have top priority. Promoting safe passage during an emergency would help ensure that in an emergency, people have the ability to leave the facility unabated and/or would allow emergency staff to arrive.Provide an operative method for delaying unauthorized entry into the facility without being seen. is incorrect. Lighting could act as a deterrent, but this would not be a primary reason to implement it.Allow emergency personnel to enter the facility in the event of an emergency. is incorrect. This answer has a human safety aspect to it but it does not account for the people who are in the building who may need to evacuate.Provide a method for rescue teams to safely evacuate distressed personnel during a terrorist attack. is incorrect. There are other types of emergencies outside of terrorist attacks that would require emergency assistance, which is what makes this answer incorrect despite it relating to the human safety element of emergencies.

questionText: A large financial organization wants to enhance the security of its cloud infrastructure by ensuring that sensitive data remains encrypted during transmission, storage, and processing. The security team is also responsible for monitoring and detecting potential threats within the cloud environment. Which of the following steps should the company FIRST prioritize to achieve these objectives?

choices.text: Deploy a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) to monitor cloud activity
Implement end-to-end encryption across all communication channels
Set up a virtual private cloud (VPC) to isolate workloads
Establish a comprehensive incident response plan

correctAnswerText: Deploy a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) to monitor cloud activity
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Deploy a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) to monitor cloud activity. Deploying a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) helps monitor and secure cloud activity, ensuring that data remains protected across various cloud services and providing visibility into potential threats.
Implement end-to-end encryption across all communication channels is incorrect. End-to-end encryption is important, but it only protects data in transit, not at rest, and not during processing. It also does not offer threat detection.
Set up a virtual private cloud (VPC) to isolate workloads is incorrect. Setting up a virtual private cloud enhances isolation but does not directly address monitoring and detection of potential threats.
Establish a comprehensive incident response plan is incorrect. Incident response is critical but focuses on handling security breaches rather than preventive monitoring and encryption.

questionText: Susan is a security practitioner who processes data for a large Fortune-100 institution.  Susan notices a breach in one of the organizations file shares.  As per GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation), who should Susan MOST likely be obligated to notify?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: The data controller. Susan is the data processor and when a data processor experiences a personal data breach, it must notify the controller but otherwise has no other notification or reporting obligation. Should the controller determine that the personal data breach “is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of individuals,” it must also communicate information regarding the personal data breach to the affected data subjects. Under Article 32, this must be done “without undue delay.”The organization’s stakeholders is incorrect. The data owner is incorrect. Regulatory organizations is incorrect.

questionText: A financial institution has implemented a data classification policy to ensure that sensitive information is appropriately protected. The organization also performs regular access control audits and applies encryption to all sensitive data. Which of the following is the PRIMARY goal of this approach?

choices.text: To prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data
To comply with data privacy regulations

correctAnswerText: To prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: To prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data. The primary goal is to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data by classifying it based on its sensitivity and applying encryption. This ensures that only those with proper authorization can access it, reducing the risk of exposure.To comply with data privacy regulations is incorrect. Compliance with regulations is a secondary benefit but not the main driver behind these security measures. The organization’s goal is broader protection.To mitigate insider threats is incorrect. While mitigating insider threats may occur through access control, the main aim is broader, focusing on overall unauthorized access.To enforce least privilege is incorrect. Enforcing least privilege is an important principle, but it’s a method of achieving the main goal, which is protecting sensitive data.

questionText: An organization is sorting through their confidential information assets to remove any that are no longer relevant. According to the data lifecycle, which of the following would be performed BEFORE the data could be removed?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Archival. Archival involves transferring data to a separate storage location, typically for long-term retention and reference, before deletion or removal from primary systems. It ensures that a record of the data exists for regulatory, legal, or historical reasons. Archiving happens after data is no longer actively used but must still be kept in a secure, often less accessible location, for potential future needs. In the data lifecycle, archival occurs before data is completely removed or deleted, making it a critical step in managing information assets.
Labeling is incorrect. While labeling is an important part of the data lifecycle, it is done early in the process. It involves assigning metadata or tags to information assets to identify their classification, such as "confidential" or "public." Labeling happens when the data is created or collected, not just before removal.
Marking is incorrect. Similar to labeling, marking is used to indicate the classification of an information asset based on its sensitivity. It ensures that the data is handled appropriately, following its classification. This process typically occurs when the data is first created or processed, rather than at the end of its lifecycle before removal.
Backups is incorrect. Backups are part of the data protection strategy. They involve creating a copy of the data to ensure its availability in case of system failure, data corruption, or other issues. Unlike archival, which is for long-term storage of inactive data, backups are designed to ensure continuity and retention of active data during its lifecycle. Both the original and backup copies are kept, and backups are not part of the process of data removal.

questionText: A company is implementing a new wireless network. Which of the following BEST describes the type of control that would be used to ensure that only authorized devices can connect to the network?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Access control. Access control. The best control for ensuring that only authorized devices can connect to a wireless network is access control, which can be used to define who can connect to the network and what resources they can access. IDS can detect malicious activity, firewalls can block unwanted traffic, and WPA2 encryption can protect data in transit, but none of these directly address the need for controlling access to the network.Intrusion detection system (IDS) is incorrect. Firewall is incorrect. WPA2 encryption is incorrect.

questionText: Daniel is a penetration tester and discovers a critical vulnerability in a webpage.  Daniel notices several JavaScript frameworks which have a vulnerability that permit the execution of an attack payload.  This vulnerability is BEST known as?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: DOM cross site scripting. JavaScript frameworks, single-page applications, and APIs that dynamically include attacker-controllable data to a page are vulnerable to DOM XSS.Cross site request forgery is incorrect. In a Cross-site request forgery (CSRF), the attacker sends a request to the browser that seems like it was made by the user.  To do this, the victim is first tricked into clicking a link. This is followed by sending a seemingly legitimate request to the website, with cookies the victim has associated with the website. A CSRF attack can work only when the victim is logged in to an account.Reflected cross site scripting is incorrect. In Reflected cross site scripting.  The application or API includes unvalidated and unescaped user input as part of HTML output. A successful attack can allow the attacker to execute arbitrary HTML and JavaScript in the victim’s browser. Typically, the user will need to interact with some malicious link that points to an attacker-controlled page.Stored cross site scripting is incorrect. In stored cross site scripting, the application or API stores unsensitized user input that is viewed at a later time by another user or an administrator.

questionText: Tom is an administrator for CoolToys Incorporated and is hardening the organization’s environment against ransomware. Tom has been advised by his manager that he needs to implement the capability to quickly isolate specific network segments from the rest of the company. Which of the below BEST achieves this goal?

choices.text: Tom implements Kerberos and disables NTLM
Tom enables and hardens the host-based firewall on every company asset
Tom implements VLANs and stages router ACLs

correctAnswerText: Tom implements VLANs and stages router ACLs
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Tom implements VLANs and stages router ACLs. VLANs are designed to enable the separation of traffic between multiple networks passing through a single switch. The staged firewall ACLs would allow quick isolation of a given subnet by denying traffic to or from that subnet.Tom implements 802.1x is incorrect. 802.1x authenticates a user's identity and authorizes access to the network.Tom enables and hardens the host-based firewall on every company asset is incorrect. Configuration changes to host-based assets takes time to roll out (not meeting the quick requirement), and has a time delta between a shut-down host being started up and receiving an updated "isolation" firewall policy.Tom implements Kerberos and disables NTLM is incorrect. Both Kerberos and NTLM are authentication mechanisms, and provide no network-based access controls in isolation.

questionText: Johnny is the CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) of a widget company. He is asked to ensure compliance with standards. Which is the BEST way for him to achieve this?

choices.text: Utilize an assessor to validate the veracity of implemented controls
Review Standards to ensure they properly adhere to Policies
Perform a risk assessment based upon industry best practices on critical path items.
Modify and implement new policies to comply with standards.

correctAnswerText: Utilize an assessor to validate the veracity of implemented controls
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Utilize an assessor to validate the veracity of implemented controls. An auditor would be best suited to verify (substantiate) compliance. Don’t get held up on verbiage too much. An assessor would assess (as would an auditor), and an appraisal is a review, and does not necessarily have to deal with money.
Review Standards to ensure they properly adhere to Policies is incorrect. While reviewing standards is a good choice, the review is not a direct action to verify compliance.
Modify and implement new policies to comply with standards. is incorrect. You would not modify policies until an auditor reviewed compliance first and indicates they may need a review/edit.
Perform a risk assessment based upon industry best practices on critical path items. is incorrect. A risk assessment is used to identify threats and vulnerabilities in order to quantify/qualify risks associated with business assets.

questionText: A government agency is responsible for handling highly sensitive data, including classified information. To protect this data, the agency employs advanced encryption, secure communication channels, and physical access controls to sensitive areas. Which security objective is being emphasized with these measures?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Confidentiality. Confidentiality is the key focus in this scenario, as the encryption, secure communication, and physical controls are aimed at preventing unauthorized individuals from accessing sensitive and classified information.Non-repudiation is incorrect. Non-repudiation ensures that actions can be traced back to a particular individual, but this isn't the focus of the mentioned controls.Accountability is incorrect. Accountability relates to tracing user activities, whereas confidentiality deals with ensuring that only authorized users can view the information.Availability is incorrect. Availability ensures that data is accessible when needed, but the measures here are intended to protect the confidentiality of the data.

questionText: Sam is the network manager at an Internet service provider and is looking to implement a solution to act as a gateway between a trusted and untrusted network.  Which of the following is the BEST solution to help mitigate risk associated with external customers?

choices.text: Utilize RuBAC (Rule Based Access Controls) to monitor and control all entry into the internal network
Deploy a bastion host to facilitate entry into a specific subset of a private network
Deploy a VPN (Virtual Private Network) to allow connection to public IP (Internet Protocol) devices.
Deploy a DMZ (Demilitarized Zone) to disrupt invalid connections from the Public Internet.

correctAnswerText: Deploy a bastion host to facilitate entry into a specific subset of a private network
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Deploy a bastion host to facilitate entry into a specific subset of a private network. A bastion host would be used to help handle external requests into an internal network. Think about a web server where you are selling a product. Users would connect to a web server which would be located on a bastion host. This allows hardening of the server to help prevent the exploitation of vulnerabilities.Deploy a VPN (Virtual Private Network) to allow connection to public IP (Internet Protocol) devices. is incorrect. A VPN would allow legitimate users to connect to a private network from a public network.Deploy a DMZ (Demilitarized Zone) to disrupt invalid connections from the Public Internet. is incorrect. A DMZ would not disrupt connection from the public internet.  Its main purpose is to allow users to connect to a network from the outside.Utilize RuBAC (Rule Based Access Controls) to monitor and control all entry into the internal network is incorrect. This is an example of a firewall.  A firewall would not be the best solution to act as a gateway, as it would utilize rules to either allow or deny certain requests.

questionText: Which of the following terms is BEST described by the process of converting a message digest to ciphertext using a secret key?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Digital Signature. A digital signature is created by encrypting a message digest with a private key, and is sent along with the message; the recipient can then use the sender's public key to decrypt the encrypted message digest and compare it to one they created themselves and if they match, they have some assurance the sender is who they say they are.Symmetric encryption is incorrect. Asymmetric encryption is incorrect. Hashing is incorrect.

questionText: Shawn is a CISSP® (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) and is tasked with the procurement of new technology based upon large organizational architectural changes and business needs.  Which of the following BEST helps Shawn achieve this?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Zachman Framework. Zachman used for enterprise architecture and is a matrix-based framework which utilizes six different perspectives. This framework is used to map technology to business changes.Graham-Denning Model is incorrect. Graham-Denning is a matrix-based methodology that is concerned with users and subjects not architectural changes or business needs.Risk Management Framework is incorrect. The Risk Management Framework is used to qualify and quantify business risk so it can be more easily managed.Harrison-Ruzzo-Ullman Model is incorrect. The Harrison-Ruzzo-Ulman model is a rights-based integrity model.

questionText: Derek is a developer and is working on the specifications of a particular behavior.  Which of the following BEST describes this part of SDLC (software development life cycle)?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Functional requirements. Functional requirements describe particular functions of the system when certain conditions are met. Essentially, these components that developers must implement to enable users to achieve their goals. Non-functional requirements are how the system should perform certain tasks. Essentially, a non-functional requirement will describe how a system should behave as well as any limitations. Prototyping is where incomplete versions of the software program are developed. Architectural design is a high-level view of the system which includes the security requirementsPrototyping is incorrect. Non-functional requirements is incorrect. Architectural design is incorrect.

questionText: A pharmaceutical company is expanding its research facility and needs to secure its wireless system to prevent unauthorized entry into sensitive research files. They are particularly concerned about potential threats targeting the safeguarding of data as it is transmitted. What wireless protection strategy would BEST maintain the reliability of communication?

choices.text: Implement MAC (Media Access Control) address filtering to limit access to authorized devices
Deploy an IPS (Intrusion Prevention System) to detect and block questionable wireless activity
Separate the wireless network into distinct VLANs (Virtual Local Area Networks)
Utilize WPA3 (Wi-Fi Protected Access 3) with 802.1X verification to secure the data flow

correctAnswerText: Utilize WPA3 (Wi-Fi Protected Access 3) with 802.1X verification to secure the data flow
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Utilize WPA3 (Wi-Fi Protected Access 3) with 802.1X verification to secure the data flow. WPA3 (Wi-Fi Protected Access 3), paired with 802.1X verification, offers the highest level of protection for data as it moves across the wireless network, ensuring that only approved users can access the network, and that communication remains safe.Separate the wireless network into distinct VLANs (Virtual Local Area Networks) is incorrect. Segregating the network into VLANs (Virtual Local Area Networks) helps organize traffic but doesn’t directly protect the transmission of sensitive information.Deploy an IPS (Intrusion Prevention System) to detect and block questionable wireless activity is incorrect. While an IPS (Intrusion Prevention System) can identify and stop harmful actions, it doesn’t ensure data protection during transmission.Implement MAC (Media Access Control) address filtering to limit access to authorized devices is incorrect. MAC (Media Access Control) address filtering is a basic measure that can be bypassed easily and doesn’t offer the same level of defense as WPA3 with 802.1X.

questionText: Amanda is leading the development of a DRP (Disaster Recovery Plan) for her organization. Which of the following is the MOST critical aspect to ensure the plan’s success?

choices.text: Performing regular disaster recovery drills and tests
Training employees on emergency response procedures
Creating an inventory of critical assets and systems

correctAnswerText: Performing regular disaster recovery drills and tests
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Performing regular disaster recovery drills and tests. Performing regular disaster recovery drills is crucial for validating the effectiveness of the DRP. These drills help ensure that the plan works as intended and that all team members are familiar with their roles during an actual disaster. It also helps identify any gaps or issues in the plan.Training employees on emergency response procedures is incorrect. Training is essential, but it comes after developing and testing the plan to ensure it’s effective.  Without an effective plan that is tested, training would be ineffective.Creating an inventory of critical assets and systems is incorrect. An inventory is important for understanding what needs to be recovered, but drills are necessary to test and refine the recovery process.Securing funding for backup infrastructure is incorrect. Securing funding is necessary for implementing the plan, but regular testing ensures the plan’s practicality and effectiveness.

questionText: Maggie is the CEO (Chief Executive Officer) of Certification Station Incorporated. After suffering its third ransomware attack in 6 months, she orders a review of how the previous incidents were handled. What part of the response to the previous incidents is the MOST likely to have not been completed correctly?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Remediation. Remediation. Although all of the answers could be correct, remediation is the most likely part of the incident response to have been completed incorrectly. The root cause analysis that is completed during remediation focuses on identifying how the attack was able to occur to then prevent it from occurring again. As the same attack has successfully occurred multiple times, it is highly likely the root cause analysis has not been completed correctly. NOTE: There is a lot of conflicting information as it pertains to the Incident Response steps and what occurs within these steps. FOR THE EXAM – RCA occurs in remediation.Documentation is incorrect. Recovery is incorrect. Lessons Learned is incorrect.

questionText: Four systems analysts are caught stealing code from a mainframe that hosts some publicly traded companies in the Stock Exchange.  All but one confess to the crime and relinquish their stolen portions of the code. The fourth will release the code only if he is not prosecuted.  Which of the following laws BEST describes the law that was broken by the four analysts?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Computer Fraud and Abuse Act. The Computer Fraud and Abuse Act in its present form lists seven specific computer crimes. Specifically, in Subsection (a)[2] it states: “Unauthorized access, or access that exceeds authorization, to a protected computer to obtain any information on that computer.” The Electronic Communications Privacy Act makes it a crime to capture an individual’s electronic privacy. There is no indication that this has occurred. The Patriot Act of 2001 expands law enforcement electronic monitoring capabilities and allows search and seizure without immediate disclosure. SOX mandates regulatory compliance for the financial reporting of publicly traded companies.Electronic Communications Privacy Act is incorrect. Patriot Act of 2001 is incorrect. Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) is incorrect.

questionText: Shirley is a Project manager and is working on an important project with the security team. Shirley is utilizing process level improvements to help appraise the team. She is finding numerous issues with its development; things such as a lack of documentation and no standardized way to implement controls. Which of the following BEST describes the issue Shirley is facing?

choices.text: The project has not yet been optimized which is causing issues with the improvement of processes
The project is not properly defined which is causing reactive issues
The project is still in its initial stages
The project is not properly managed which is causing reactive issues

correctAnswerText: The project is still in its initial stages
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: The project is still in its initial stages. The project is still in Stage 1 of the CMMI (Capability Maturity Model Integrated). This is where the process is not standardized or repeatable, poorly controlled, and reactive.
The project is not properly defined which is causing reactive issues is incorrect. The defined stage of CMMI is where the process is characterized for the organization and is proactive, not reactive.
The project is not properly managed which is causing reactive issues is incorrect. The managed stage of CMMI is often characterized and reactive.
The project has not yet been optimized which is causing issues with the improvement of processes is incorrect. This is the last stage of CMMI and is focused on process improvement.

questionText: Maggie is a director in charge of the risk management team for her organization. As required by her organization's charter, Maggie is performing a risk analysis for her organization and has just identified predisposing conditions. Which of the following would occur NEXT?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Determine likelihood of occurrence. A risk assessment as per NIST SP800-30R1 lists the appropriate steps that need to be completed.
Step 1 - Prepare for Assessment
                Step 2 - Conduct Assessment
                                i. Identify threat sources & events
                                ii. Identify vulnerabilities & predisposing conditions
                                iii. Determine likelihood of occurrence
                                iv. Determine magnitude of impact
                                v. Determine Risk
                Step 3 - Communicate Results
                Step 4 - Maintain Assessment
Dissemination of results is incorrect.
Identification of threat events is incorrect.
Determine Risk is incorrect.

questionText: A company is implementing a new security monitoring system. Which of the following BEST describes the type of control that would be used to ensure that alerts are properly prioritized?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Threat intelligence. Threat intelligence. Threat intelligence involves collecting and analyzing information about potential threats, and using that information to prioritize alerts and responses. Risk assessment, impact analysis, and business continuity planning are important components of an effective security program, but are not specifically focused on prioritizing alerts.Risk assessment is incorrect. Impact analysis is incorrect. Business continuity planning (BCP) is incorrect.

questionText: Asymmetric encryption requires the use of two keys, a private key and a public key. Which of the following answers BEST describes the purpose of a private key?

choices.text: Encrypt a message and digitally sign a message.
Decrypt a message and verify a digitally signed message.
Encrypt a message and verify a digitally signed message.
Decrypt a message and digitally sign a message.

correctAnswerText: Decrypt a message and digitally sign a message.
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Decrypt a message and digitally sign a message.   In asymmetric encryption, the private key is used for decrypting messages that were encrypted with the corresponding public key and for digitally signing messages to ensure authenticity and integrity. When a message is signed with the private key, the recipient can verify the sender’s identity using the sender’s public key.
Decrypt a message and verify a digitally signed message. is incorrect.  Verification of a digital signature is done with the public key, not the private key.
Encrypt a message and verify a digitally signed message. is incorrect.  Encryption for confidentiality is done with the recipient’s public key, not the sender’s private key.  Also, signature verification is done with the public key, not the private key.
Encrypt a message and digitally sign a message. is incorrect.  The private key is not used for encryption, only for decryption and signing.

questionText: Lauren is a security practitioner for a book publisher. Lauren is reviewing the organization's procedures related to protection of their Intellectual property. Which of the following is NOT one of the five rights associated with a copyright?

choices.text: Protection from unauthorized reproduction for 95 years
Reproduce the work in any form, language, or medium

correctAnswerText: Protection from unauthorized reproduction for 95 years
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Protection from unauthorized reproduction for 95 years. The five rights associated with a copyright are:
(i) Reproduce the work in any form, language, or medium
(ii) Adapt or derive more works from it
(iii) Make and distribute its copies
(iv) Perform it in public
(v) Display or exhibit it in public  
Reproduce the work in any form, language, or medium is incorrect.
Adapt or derive more works is incorrect.
Create and distribute copies is incorrect.

questionText: Ross is a cybersecurity professional implementing Type 3 biometric authentication devices for his organization. Considering both accuracy and ethical factors related to privacy and user comfort, which of the following would provide the BEST solution?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Iris scan. The colored portion of the eye that surrounds the pupil is used to establish identity or provide authentication is an Iris scan. Iris scans are highly accurate, quick, and less invasive compared to retina scans, making them a more practical, privacy-respecting solution for biometric authentication.
Synchronous security token is incorrect. Synchronous tokens are time-synchronized with an authentication server to generate a One-Time Password (OTP). These tokens and the server operate with independent clocks that must be synchronized to the same time base. The OTP generated is valid only for a short time. If the clocks between the token and the authentication server drift too far apart, the OTP will fail, and authentication will not be successful.  While synchronous tokens enhance authentication security, they are not biometric solutions because they do not rely on a user’s unique physical or behavioral characteristics (e.g., fingerprints, facial recognition, retina scans, or voice patterns). Instead, they rely on time-based cryptographic algorithms to generate OTPs.  Biometric solutions, on the other hand, are based on measurable, inherent traits of a person that are virtually impossible to replicate, making them distinct from token-based mechanisms. Synchronous tokens, therefore, do not leverage any biological data and instead depend solely on cryptographic synchronization.
Retina scan is incorrect. A retina scan is a laser scan of the capillaries that feed the retina of the back of the eye. The user needs to press their eye up to the last scanner eyecup and may raise privacy issues due to conditions such as diabetes and pregnancy. Due to the need for proximity bodily fluids can be exchanged.
Hand geometry is incorrect. Measurements are taken from specific points on the subject’s hands – length, width, thickness, surface area.  While less invasive, hand geometry is not as accurate as iris scans and is also becoming less commonly used due to technological advancements.

questionText: A company has implemented a security awareness training program for all employees. Which of the following BEST describes the goal of this program?

choices.text: To reduce the likelihood of insider threats
To ensure compliance with regulatory requirements

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: To prevent social engineering attacks. To prevent social engineering attacks. The goal of security awareness training is to educate employees about the risks of social engineering attacks, such as phishing or pretexting. By teaching employees how to recognize and respond to these attacks, organizations can reduce their risk of falling victim to them.To improve incident response capabilities is incorrect. To reduce the likelihood of insider threats is incorrect. To ensure compliance with regulatory requirements is incorrect.

questionText: Ava is a business analyst for a pharmaceutical company. Ava has privileges to a website used for banking that stores her credentials locally. Ava then notices a withdrawal of the business account that she did not authorize. This Vulnerability is BEST known as?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Cross site request forgery. In a Cross-site request forgery (CSRF), the attacker sends a request to the browser that seems like it was made by the user. To do this, the victim is first tricked into clicking a link. This is followed by sending a seemingly legitimate request to the website, with cookies the victim has associated with the website. A CSRF attack can work only when the victim is logged in to an account.
DOM cross site scripting is incorrect.  This involves manipulating the Document Object Model (DOM) of the web page through client-side scripts. However, it does not directly explain the unauthorized withdrawal from the account based on stored credentials.
Reflected cross site scripting is incorrect. In Reflected cross site scripting. The application or API includes unvalidated and unescaped user input as part of HTML output. A successful attack can allow the attacker to execute arbitrary HTML and JavaScript in the victim’s browser. Typically, the user will need to interact with some malicious link that points to an attacker-controlled page.
Stored cross site scripting is incorrect. This involves an attacker permanently injecting a script into a web page and is more focused on data theft or manipulating the website content, not specifically causing unauthorized actions like a withdrawal.

questionText: Frank is a software engineer and is developing system architecture in a linear structured phase with limited requirements. What should Frank do NEXT?

choices.text: Perform a systematic discovery and debug any defects

fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Unit Testing. Frank is an engineer using the waterfall model. With waterfall, there tends to be a lack of requirements and each phase is performed in a step-by-step approach. After the design of the software has been finalized (which includes the software architecture), coding is the next phase, and this includes development, unit testing, and integration of the software.Perform support and maintenance is incorrect. Perform a systematic discovery and debug any defects is incorrect. Software Integration is incorrect.

questionText: Scott is a security practitioner and is responsible for protecting data to ensure accessibility.  Which of the following would be the BEST countermeasure to ensure compliance?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Firewalls. Scott is responsible for ensuring that data is available. Of the four options a firewall is the BEST choice. A firewall can help mitigate risks associated with DDOS (distributed denial of service) attacks. Both Hashing and an IDS are used to help ensure integrity. Traffic padding is also used for confidentiality and it adds additional data in network traffic which in turn obfuscates the sender, receiver, and/or the data being transmitted.Hashing is incorrect. IDS (Intrusion Detection System) is incorrect. Traffic Padding is incorrect.

questionText: Jamal is a security professional and is contracted to report on a service organization’s facilities.  In his report, Jamal notes specifics about room size and other physical attributes.  What type of report BEST describes what Jamal is tasked with?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: SOC2 Plus. SOC2 plus expanded the use of SOC 2 in two significant ways by reporting criteria and alignment with other significant IT Security regulations. Completeness, accuracy and criteria specified by an outside party in relation to the description of physical characteristics of a facility in included in SOC 2 plus coverage. https://www.ssae-16.com/soc-2/soc-2-additional-subject-matter-soc2-plus/Crime Prevention through Environmental Design (CPTED) is incorrect. CPTED is where the proper design and effective use of an environment can lead to a reduction in the fear of crime and the incidence of crime.  There are three main elements: territoriality, access control, and surveillance.TEMPEST is incorrect. TEMPEST is the study and control of electronic signals produced by various types of electronic hardware, such as computers, televisions, phones, etc. The primary goal of TEMPEST is to prevent electromagnetic and Radio frequency radiation in order to eliminate the possibility of monitoring, eavesdropping, and signal sniffing.Privacy Risk Assessment is incorrect. Privacy risk management is a cross-organizational set of processes that helps organizations to understand how their systems, products, and services may create problems for individuals and how to develop effective solutions to manage such risks.

questionText: Mann Industries is a mid-level consulting firm that has just acquired a large amount of data it purchased from a third party and stored it on its central server. As a Security Practitioner for Mann Industries, you have just completed developing the backup and recovery process. What stage of the Data Lifecycle Management Plan (DLM) occurs NEXT?
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Usage. Usage. You have finished the backup process for the newly created data, which means you have completed the storage phase of the DLM.
The 5 Stages of Data Lifecycle Management:
1. Data Creation - The first phase of the data lifecycle is the creation/capture of data. Data is typically
created by an organization in one of 3 ways:
a. Data Acquisition: acquiring already existing data which has been produced outside the
organization.
B. Data Entry: manual entry of new data by personnel within the organization
C. Data Capture: capture of data generated by devices used in various processes in the organization.
2. Storage - Once data has been created within the organization, it needs to be stored and protected, with the appropriate level of security applied, which includes classifying it for easy retrieval and determining access controls. For example, files can be marked as “internal” or “external,” which then decides how tight of a lid it needs to be kept under.
3. Usage - Data is used to support activities in the organization. Data can be viewed, processed, modified and saved.
4. Archival - The copying of data to an environment where it is stored in case it is needed again in an active production environment, and the removal of this data from all active production environments.
a. A data archive is simply a place where data is stored, but where no maintenance or general usage occurs. If necessary, the data can be restored to an environment where it can be used.
5. Destruction - Data destruction or purging is the removal of every copy of a data item from an organization. It is typically done from an archive storage location. – Source:  Adam Gordon – Author of ISC2 CBK v4.
Creation is incorrect.
Storage is incorrect.
Archival is incorrect.

questionText: Acme Incorporated is a crayon manufacturer with a large customer base. The company wants to ensure their risk posture is at an acceptable level and therefore are implementing new tools to aid in the overall BC/DR (business continuity and disaster recovery process). Which of the following would BEST assist with this process?

choices.text: Dual homed firewall to prevent and monitor all ingress and egress traffic
Proper adherence of a clean desk policy
Background checks of all employees on a semi-annual basis

fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Cross-training for redundancy directly supports business continuity by ensuring that critical skills and functions are maintained, even if specific individuals or departments are unavailable, making it the best option.
Dual homed firewall to prevent and monitor all ingress and egress traffic is incorrect. Firewalls are not generally used to assist with recovery strategies associated with BC/DR.
Background checks of all employees on a semi-annual basis is incorrect. Background check is an administrative/preventative control and can be used to help ensure employees are ethical. It would not help with BC/DR
Proper adherence of a clean desk policy is incorrect. While important for security and data protection, a clean desk policy primarily addresses physical security and confidentiality. It doesn't directly aid in BC/DR or contribute to organizational redundancy.

questionText: You are working as a Project Manager for a physical security subsidiary that makes biometric locks. You have just finished testing their latest product to ensure that it meets the documented requirements.  What should be performed NEXT?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Accreditation. Accreditation. The test has just been tested to ensure it meets the documented requirements which is essentially Certification. After Certification, the next step would be accreditation, which is where management evaluates the product and decides if they will formally accept any risks.Quality Assurance is incorrect. correctly throughout the development lifecycle. It is typically performed before testing, not after the product has been tested. Therefore, QA should have already occurred, and this step is not appropriate after testing.Quality Control is incorrect. Quality Control (QC) involves the process of inspecting and testing the product to ensure that it meets the specified quality standards. Since the question states that testing has already been completed, QC has already been performed, making this an incorrect next step.Certification is incorrect. Certification involves the formal confirmation that the product meets documented standards and requirements. In this scenario, the testing has already verified the product’s compliance with requirements, which aligns with certification. Therefore, this step has likely been completed.

questionText: Ernie is working with a contractor to test and implement an in-house developed application. Management requested Ernie to ensure that proper methods are in place to ensure secure, unbiased testing and production implementation is done. Which security model is MOST suitable in this case?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Brewer-Nash. Brewer-Nash is a security model primarily used to prevent conflicts of interest. Due to Ernie’s use of a third-party contractor and the fact that testing and production should be separated, this is the best answer.Bell-LaPadula is incorrect. Graham–Denning is incorrect. Biba is incorrect.

questionText: Jose has been tasked with evaluating the security of an Industrial Control System (ICS) at a manufacturing facility. His evaluation includes inspecting various components directly and identifying vulnerabilities that could be easily exploited by an attacker. Which BEST describes what Jose is doing?

choices.text: Jose is a penetration tester with physical access to the system which allows an in depth look at the systems.
Jose is a hacker with no knowledge of the system he is penetrating and is hired to attempt to break into a system to demonstrate protection flaws.009uhgy
Jose attempted to circumvent the security features of the system to identify where weaknesses exist, so that they may be better bound.
Jose is part of an APT (advanced present threat) with the goal of using sophisticated tools such as key loggers and Ransomware to identify mechanisms for intrusion.

correctAnswerText: Jose is a penetration tester with physical access to the system which allows an in depth look at the systems.
fullExplanation:
Correct Answer: Jose is a penetration tester with physical access to the system which allows an in depth look at the systems.  Penetration testers simulate attacks on systems to identify security weaknesses, and having physical access allows them to perform a more thorough evaluation.
Jose is a hacker with no knowledge of the system he is penetrating and is hired to attempt to break into a system to demonstrate protection flaws. is incorrect. This describes a black-box penetration test, but the question suggests Jose has access and a clear goal, which aligns more with a structured penetration testing role.
Jose attempted to circumvent the security features of the system to identify where weaknesses exist, so that they may be better bound. is incorrect. While this describes part of the penetration testing process, it doesn't capture the professional role Jose is playing nor what he is doing in its entirety.  
Jose is part of an APT (advanced present threat) with the goal of using sophisticated tools such as key loggers and Ransomware to identify mechanisms for intrusion. is incorrect. APTs are typically external threat actors with malicious intent. The scenario suggests that Jose is conducting a legitimate security assessment, not acting as part of a threat group.

questionText: Kyle is a project manager overseeing a large application.  After discussion with the team about the requirements, he decides to break off pieces of the project into sections and utilize repeated cycles. Which model of SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) would BEST fit these needs?
fullExplanation: Correct Answer: Iterative. The iterative model is meant for large applications and is broken down into repeated cycles.Incremental is incorrect. The incremental model is where a product is designed, implemented & tested a little bit at a time.  Each component is delivered to the customer when it is complete.Waterfall is incorrect. The Waterfall model utilizes a sequential approach where you cannot go back phases.  It is generally slow and deliberate.Agile is incorrect.
